The player will encounter many obstacles on their way, for example chests that will have to be moved properly, closed doors requiring finding the key, deadly cannons or electromagnets attracting metal objects. Robbo can use a gun after finding ammunition, use bombs placed on the board, and travel through teleporters.
title: Robbo Forever

description: 3d24 is a side-scrolling puzzle solving action game, similar to Robbo. The player controls a robot. His goal is to collect all the TVs, avoiding enemy robots, other hostile lifeforms and numerous traps. The player will encounter many obstacles on their way, for example chests that will have to be moved properly, closed doors requiring finding the key, deadly cannons, sucking devices or suddenly falling spikes. The player can use two weapons - a gun after finding ammunition, and bombs placed on the board.

sample_screenshots.caption: Chest as a shield against cannon
Doors on the right - require key to open
Shooting a bomb, and falling spike on the right

title: 3d24

description:
Fluid-Kha is a platform game. The player was shifted in time to the ancient Egypt. Crossing through the pyramid of Chephren the player has to find specific items and deliver them to the spirit of Kha. In return, he will receive immortality and the title of Pharaoh. The pyramid is inhabited by hostile creatures, such as spiders, scarabs or mummies and protected by numerous traps, such as falling drops, fire and others. Contact with them means instant death.

Although Fluid-Kha features a colorful animated intro, the graphics in the game are black and white.

sample_screenshots.caption: The road to the ancient temple of Apis

title: Fluid-Kha

description:
This is a compilation of two puzzle board games:* Isora with the isometric view, where the player must step on each tile once (or more in later stages) and come back to the starting position. The game features board rotating option. The completion of the board ahead of time gives the extra points. The game does not limit the number of trials but the second attempt and the next ones denote no point bonus.

  • Loops DX with the top down view, where the player must join all the elements by rotating appropriate elements. The game features two types of boards with eight levels each.

sample_screenshots.caption: Isora - Level 9 - tiles with dots require double step through

title: Isora / Loops DX

description: Agonia is an action platform game. The aim of the player is to find secret plans hidden in the locked and highly guarded safe and getting to the evacuation exit. The game takes place in a base consisting of three levels. Changing the level of the base is possible after finding a magnetic card allowing access to the elevator. To open the safe the player must launch the main computer and find the burner and the gas bottle. The base is guarded by the soldiers, mechanical or electric barriers. The player has no weapon, he can only jump and avoid enemies. Contact with the enemies means a loss of energy, contact with electricity and acid means an instant death. The energy power-ups are not implemented in the game. The main character may carry up to four items.

sample_screenshots.caption: Electric barriers - contact means an instant death

title: Agonia

description: Maszyna Czasu is a platform shooter. The aim of the player is to find the designated number of screws, floppy disks and keys necessary to open the doors. The contact with numerous obstacles, such as shooting soldiers, spiders, snakes, spikes or flames cost some energy. The energy level may be increased up to 150 percent by collecting the screws (2 percent each) and mugs (20 percent each) or killing the hostile soldiers (4 percent each). The player has a pistol with unlimited ammo. The enemy soldiers appear again after returning to the previous screen and may be used as and extra energy boost.

sample_screenshots.caption: Arrows on the wall shows the possible direction of motion
Two items and three obstacles ahead

title: Maszyna Czasu

description: Repossed is a puzzle board game. The player's task is to direct the worm to go through the exit block 'E' by the appropriate shifting blocks 'O'. In each turn the worm moves by 15 regions in designated direction until it encounters an obstacle causing change of the current path. Changing the path the worm always tries to move according to a clockwise direction. The player may move up to 15 fields in each turn. Apart from directing the worm to exit area the player must prevent the worm from entering the deadly glowing squares.

sample_screenshots.caption: Lured into trap worm travels toward the goal

title: Repossed

description: Bomb Jake is an arcade action game, a clone of Bomb Jack released by Tehkan Ltd.. The main character of the game is Jack. His task is to collect all the bombs on the board, avoiding the movement paths of the numerous enemies such as birds, mummies, turtles, and orbs. The game features a few power-ups in the form of hexagons with a specific letter in (f.e. E - an extra life, P turns the enemies into tokens, B - doubles the gained points for collecting bombs). The only weapon of the Jake is the short and long jumping ability combined with a perfect timing when trying to find a gap between the enemies.
title: Bomb Jake

description: Alchemia is an action platform game. The story begins when Berediusz wakes up in a strange place. To return to the home the player must find the indicated number of amphoras on each of the four levels. The task is complicated by the passage of time and the numerous creatures inhabiting the maze. The contact with the hostile objects means a loss of the energy, the fall on spikes - instant death.

sample_screenshots.caption: Last one - but no time remaining
Time to move to a lower level

title: Alchemia

description: Magia Fortuny is a Polish video game based on the TV show Wheel of Fortune. The players take turns guessing letters to form a word or a saying. The game can be played with up to three human players. During their turn the players can spin the wheel, guess a consonant, buy a vowel or guess a password. The game faithfully reflects the principle of the TV show, introducing the most famous taunts of the Polish presenter conducting the program. After completing the round the player may visit the Magic of Fortune shop and spend the earned money.

sample_screenshots.caption: Turn lost - the operator is happy

title: Magia Fortuny

description:
Pang is an action game similar to Dyna Blaster / Bomberman for up to two players. The goal of the game is to kill all the living beings in the maze and find the doors to the next level before the time runs out. The player has only time-bombs at his disposal and he may use them to blow out the walls and kill the enemies. When the player knocks down a part of the wall, it may reveal a hidden door and bonus items, such as increased bomb power (thunder icon), speed up (S icon), extra energy (cross icon) or surprise package. The contact with the enemies and exploding bomb means a large loss of energy.

The game features a total of thirty levels.
title: Pang

description: Pandemonium is a side scrolling action game. The player controls an owl which must safely go through a cave full of obstacles, such as stalactites and stalagmites, dangling vines or winging stars. The contact with any part of the bird with each obstacle means a loss of energy. The player may use temporary immortality in order to avoid the cost of contact with an obstacle. The owl moves at a steady pace to the right, the player can only move it in each direction within its current location.

sample_screenshots.caption: Cave entry, the player must avoid touching the obstacles with any part of the bird
Temporary immortality - the bird is white
Big wings do not facilitate the task

title: Pandemonium

description: Darkness Hour is a timed action platform game. The goal of the player is to find the designated number of butterflies before the end of the night. On each level the player may find the limited number of keys necessary to open the doors. Some of the doors lead to a blind alley, incorrect usage of the keys ends up with a game over message. The passing of the time limit finishes the game automatically, no matter how many lives remaining. The game features a total of three levels with a system of teleports, transferring to other parts of the maze. Shaman-like enemies may be killed by using unlimited throwing knives, contact with them or with the sharp spikes means a certain death.

sample_screenshots.caption: Closed doors on the left side

title: Darkness Hour

description: Aurum is a timed action platform game. The player's task is to collect the coins scattered randomly around the castle. The coins can be converted into additional energy (one coin), extra time (two coins) and scrolls (three coins). To complete the game the player must acquire ten scrolls. The castle is inhabited by numerous bats. The contact with them and with the glowing dots takes one point of energy. The player may not use a weapon, controlled high jump is the only featured special ability.

sample_screenshots.caption: Avoiding the glowing dots means contact with the bats
Round stones are the false platforms

title: Aurum

description: Super Fortuna Edytor is a passwords editor to the game Super Fortuna.
title: Super Fortuna Edytor

description: SOS Saturn is an action adventure game. The game takes place in the year 2122 on the international research station on the planet Saturn, took over by the alien forces. The only hope for rescue is getting through the ranks of the enemy to broadcast the help signal from the main computer transmitter. The aim is to find appropriate objects scattered in the underground of the planet and use them in the appropriate places, necessary to accomplish the mission. The player has an unlimited ammo. The contact with the enemies or spikes means an instant death. The player can carry a total of five items. The biggest problem is the numerous unnecessary items that can't be put down.

sample_screenshots.caption: Plates blocking the passage, need a bomb to remove them

title: SOS Saturn

description: Sexquix is a computer adaptation of classic tic-tac-toe game for adults. The game allows to play only against the computer. Each win reveals part of the picture of a naked model, each loss cover it back. The game features a total of sixteen pictures of nude models.
title: Sexquix

description: Banzai is an adaptation of the classic tic-tac-toe game for up to two players, played on a 18 by 21 board. The goal is to arrange five dots in a row. The game allows to play against the computer or a human player, choose small or big dots for pieces and color or black and white monitor.
title: Banzai

description:
Sky Writer is an educational action game for children.

You steer the plane "Sky Writer" and while you are flying, clouds with words in them are drifting by.

Your goal is to combine two root words to create a compound word that fits the description at the top of the screen. For example the description says "Well-mannered guy" then the answer would be "gentle" + "man" = "gentleman" For each correct root word you score 10 times the number of the level you're at.

If you choose a wrong root word or if you get the correct root words in the wrong order your plane will crash. Your plane will also crash if it flies into a raincloud, which will appear from level 3 onwards. If you run out of fuel your plane will also crash. There is no way to refill your fuel, so you better hurry.

The game has 8 levels and you can choose whether you want to start from level 1 or level 3 in the options menu. When you complete a level, you score 10 the number of the level you're at, multiplied by the number of fuel units you have left. Should you make it all the way through level 8, you score an additional 5 percent of your total score for each unused plane and you'll also receive a bonus message.
title: Sky Writer

description: Tawerna is a computer adaptation of classic table hockey arcade game for two players. The player may choose the game against the computer or another human player. To score the point the player must win five balls. To win the game the player must earn three points. Each winning point by the computer is seasoned with an extra commentary.

sample_screenshots.caption: Broken glass shows the place where the ball hit the board

title: Tawerna

description: T-34: The Battle is a variant of Scorched Earth for two players. The player can activate four indicators at start: wind, gravity, land scape and direction. At the start of each round players set up tank position, aim the cannon and strength of shot. Hitting the enemy tank ends the duel. The missile flight is shown as a side scrolling animation. The winning tank starts the next duel.
title: T-34: The Battle

description: Technus is a platform game, similar to Turrican. In the year 3748 the Intergalactic Command Center faces a new deadly threat. Davor rebels began construction of weapons of mass destruction. Neutralization of the weaponry requires finding eight reservoirs with liquid hydrogen and placing them in a special reactor. The task was entrusted to the latest generation cyborg called Technus, equipped with a laser blaster and a limited ability of controlled jumping. The numerous enemies must be eliminated or avoided, contact with them or with rotating golden stars takes some energy. The energy and ammo may be supplemented by collecting special power ups.
title: Technus

description: Wyprawy Kupca is a turn-based trade game. The goal of the game is to accumulate 15 million of currency in order to save the daughter before the indicated deadline will pass. The game is divided into turns, each turn represents a single month. The player begins with a ship of 500 units capacity (can be extended in the yard) and 50 thousand currency. The player may trade goods in nine cities and purchase shares, gamble in the casino or smuggle illegal stuff, according to the rule "buy cheap and sell expensive".

sample_screenshots.caption: Meeting with smuggler requires paying a ticket

title: Wyprawy Kupca

description: Inside is a side-scrolling action game for up to two players, based on the C64 game Chip-War. The player controls a ship placed inside the computer (on the main board) who has to repair all eight chips needed to supply the power to the computer. After finding the broken chip the player is transferred to the diagram board. The player must replace the damaged parts before time runs out. At any time the player can check the amount of remaining errors (T letter) or view the correct schema (S letter, costs 100 time units). Not repaired components results in loss of computer power. All damages affect the game itself, for example, damaged sound card distorts the music, damaged graphics card blurs the screen view, damaged joystick port interacts with steering the ship. Reaching the zero power level turns off the computer and ends the game.
title: Inside

description:
One hundred years ago your ancestors defeated a powerful force of space pirates to secure a new beginning for the humans who are inhabiting the planet Tintagel 4.

Now, a century later, space pirates want to attack the ring worlds surrounding Tintagel 4.

As a direct descendant of the legendary hero "Speedhawk", it is your task to stop them by infiltrating their motherships and destroy the mutant guardians (which serve as bosses) at the end of each level.

Hostile space fighters and turrets will try to protect their motherships, but if you manage to destroy a space fighter it might give you a power-up. But be warned as they can also be shot and will be destroyed. They also might fly away if you don't collect them in time.

sample_screenshots.caption: Ship may move around the screen

title: Speed Hawk

description: Trisz Divinis is a platform game. The player has been turned into a creep and thrown into the maze. His goal is to find the five herbs scattered through the labyrinth. Before the player will be able to collect the herbs he needs to find a pouch. The maze is inhabited by many hostile creatures and packed with many traps, contact with any of them means the loss of life. Besides the herbs the player must collect the keys to open the doors and the mirrors to go through the magic stones. The player may also encounter adding extra live power-ups.

sample_screenshots.caption: Magic stone requires the mirror to go through
Need to find a way to get those keys

title: Trisz Divinis

description: Puzmania is a cartoon style timed puzzle game. The game starts with five pictures to choose from. On each level a new image appears. The player chooses the image from pictures that keep rapidly changing. Each puzzle consists of a set of twenty parts. The bottom of the screen consists of time indicator and a belt with constantly moving puzzles. After selecting one piece the player must place it in the appropriate place on the board. For the remaining time the player receives bonus points. The game ends when the time runs out. The game saves the progress every five levels and thus the player does not have to start from scratch.
title: Puzmania

alternate_titles.title: Lancelot: The Hunt of Holly Gral

description: Lancelot is a platform game. The player assumes the role of a green gnome, named Lancelot. His task is to find the legendary Holy Grail, hidden somewhere in the neighborhood of the Knights of the Round Table castle. The castle and its surroundings are inhabited by hostile creatures and various traps. Collision with an enemy or a trap leads to the loss of energy. Lancelot may find many treasures, keys needed to open the numerous doors and extra energy power-ups.

sample_screenshots.caption: Bird is the most common hostile creature in the game

title: Lancelot

description: Ship is a timed puzzle board arcade game. The player controls a constantly moving device which has to remove all the colored squares from the board and reach the exit before the time runs out. To do so, the player must touch a blot of paint, changing the color of the device, which allows him to remove squares of the same color. In addition to the time limit, the player has to watch out for moving enemies and crosses which change between red (harmless) and white (deadly). Once in a while the player may acquire bonuses appearing on the level, such as extra time, temporary ability to control the device (moves into one indicated field), temporary immortality shield. Further levels introduce a lot of board modifications, such as teleports moving the device to a different location.

sample_screenshots.caption: E letter is a shield power-up icon

title: Ship

description: Zbir is a platform game. The action takes place in a Malaskara river basin, in a land called Krugundia. The player is a common thug, who turned out to be a forgotten prince. To regain the player must traverse the castle of evil sorcerer to find three symbols of authority: crown, scepter and golden apple. Some locked places are available after finding the appropriate items. The castle is inhabited by randomly appearing hostile beings, such as phantoms, mutants, spiders or ghosts. The contract with them means a loss of life. The creatures may be killed by a short sword or over jumped.

sample_screenshots.caption: Key required to open the doors

title: Zbir

description:
Minidash is a Boulder Dash clone created for the "NOMAM Basic Ten-Liners 2014" competition. The entire code, written in the Turbo Basic XL language, is 10 lines long.

The player controls a character who digs through the ground, collecting diamonds. The player goes to the next level if he collects all the diamonds (in which case he receives a score bonus), or if the timer runs out. Apart from the diamonds, the map can have boulders or brick walls in it. More and more of these elements appear on every new level, in a random layout. Boulders and diamonds are affected by gravity, and crush the player if they fall on him, transporting him back to the starting position and taking away a life. Boulders can also be pushed left and right.

sample_screenshots.caption: A few levels down the line
Beginning of the first level (no title screen)
The colors glitch out on levels with particularly high numbers

title: Minidash

description:
Planets is a simple two-player game created for the "NOMAM Basic Ten-Liners 2014" competition. The entire code, written in the Turbo Basic XL language, is 10 lines long.

There are two planets on the screen, with a random size and position. Each player uses a joystick to control a cannon on the surface of his planet. The cannon can be moved along the surface of the planet, and a missile can be launched with the "fire" key. Missiles are affected by gravitational pull as they fly. A missile digs a hole in the planet when it strikes. The cannons cannot be moved over a hole in the planet's surface. A player wins if he destroys his opponent's planet by managing to fire a missile into its center.

sample_screenshots.caption: The fight escalates. The glitchy dots around the planets are left by the cannons which are blocked by holes.
Victory. The enemy planet flashes through several colors, then disappears.
Two planets at the beginning of the game (no title screen)
Blown some holes into the enemy planet

title: Planets

description: Missmind: Sara is a puzzle-board game. The player's task is to guess the sequence of five digits in six attempts. At the top of the screen the player indicates digits from 0 to 9. The results of the trials are shown on the top right side of the screen: full dot is a perfect match, half full dot means that the digit occurs in a different place.

sample_screenshots.caption: Half full means wrong position, full icon means correct digit.

title: Missmind: Sara

description:
"A bug has to eat." These words of wisdom set the premise for the unlikely elevation of the gypsy moth to video game protagonist. Indeed, Avalon Hill's Gypsy puts you in the bare feet of a smiling, happy-go-lucky gypsy moth caterpillar who has come upon a backyard with the rare and lucious Qok tree. Our hero could feast all day in idyllic bliss, munching on leaves and sipping nectar from blossoms. Alas, such a delicious tree is a resource contested. There are Flying Ants of Tasmania crawling over the bark, the Locknest Spider, and worst of all, the truly painful-in-the-posterior, Fandango Bee.

The Qok tree, your playing field, is spread abundantly in elevation across eight screens, and you steer the smiling, fat caterpillar around it via the branches and trunk. Leaves are everywhere, continuously regrowing, and easy to munch, but the real points lie in the blossoms, which come and go in mere seconds, making it a race to get the ravenous little mouth chomping in the right spot. The tiny ants will throw you from the branch, so they must be avoided. The Fandango Bee at first just randomly flits by, but after enough time watching the caterpillar munch on her beloved tree, this fury from lower Sumatra will pursue and sting. Each sting -- and ant and spider bite -- subtracts points, but by the third one, the little caterpillar turns a sickly shade of blue and moves slowly. The fourth sting leaves it a crumpled heap on the grass below, just another lesson of nature.

sample_screenshots.caption: Game over laying flat on the grass below the tree

title: GYPSY

description: Stryczek is a word-guessing game for up to two players based on the original paper and pencil Hangman. The game shows a password covered by series of blank spaces. The player's task is to guess the password in a certain number of attempts. Each correct answer gives a point, each wrong answer draws a part of a hanged man. After reaching a certain amount of mistakes the player becomes a hangman and the game ends. In two player mode contestants alternately guess the same password, knowing the letters given by the opponent. Each of them has its own gallows.
title: Stryczek

description:
A single patrol ship faces countless invading aliens, dropping relentlessly from the top of the screen. The pilot maneuvers desperately over jagged terrain between blasts from alien ships, trying to stop as many as possible from landing. How will it end? The same way most computer simulations of lone heroism against countless invaders: not well for the pilot, but perhaps a high score for the player.

Moon Patrol joined the countless clones of the coin-operated arcade games invading home computers in the 1980's. There are no astronauts to protect, just invading saucers to shoot, but the aliens keep shooting back even after they land on the hardest difficulty. Consequently, the terrain becomes a real hazard as you drop low to blast saucers on the ground. Fuel is a limiting factor, even though there is always enough to get you to the next landing pad. The problem is that you only have one pass at the pad; there is no reverse, and while you can slow down, there is no stopping. Four levels of difficulty from alien ships that do not shoot back to aliens shooting at you when coming down and after landing.

sample_screenshots.caption: Landed taking on fuel ready for next level
Level complete with landing pad in sight
Destroyed one alien ship but another is descending quickly
Two player hot seat with player indicated by arrow

title: Moon Patrol

description: Tech is a 'Light Cycle' game for two human players. The good one is the lord of the system and the evil one - the Tech program. The aim depends on the selected side - defending the world against viruses or takeover of the entire IT infrastructure. Each player drives around the board leaving a solid trail behind. The collision with the trail or the board edge means a loss of the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Lord of the system won the game

title: Tech

description:
Das Thera-med Zahnschutz-Spiel (German for "The Thera-med toothpaste game") is an 1-player action game based on the German toothpaste "Thera-med" from the company Henkel.

The evil plaque devils are invading teeth! Stop them by brushing them off. If you brush teeth long enough they will turn blue and blue teeth can't be invaded by plaque devils. Be careful though, because if you don't brush off a plaque invader in time the tooth will turn black and you won't get any points for that tooth.

The game has 3 difficulty levels: leicht (easy), mittel (medium), and schwer (hard).
title: Das Thera-med Zahnschutz-Spiel

description:
Thrax Lair is a vertical shoot'em-up, that kind of resembles River Raid.

Thrax, insect-like, cave-dwelling creatures, have always stolen the eggs from tarps and their offsprings. Tarps are pterodactyl-size creatures that have the ability to shoot electro-chemical energy through its eyes. This is a recreation of a tarp raid on a thrax lair.

You control up to 3 tarps and for every 10,000 points you score you are awarded with an extra tarp. The tarp can fire energy bursts from its eyes in the front direction, left, right, and the diagonal front directions. You score points by shooting enemies. The faster you fly the more points you get. Depending on the kind of thrax you are awarded with more or less points:

Workers will give you 30 victory points. Soldiers will give you 75 victory points. Stingers will give you 150 victory points. Monitors will give you 350 victory points. To kill a Monitor or Stinger you have to hit the eyes.
title: Thrax Lair

description:
Maze is a game created for the "NOMAM Basic Ten-Liners 2014" competition. The entire code, written in the Turbo Basic XL language, is 10 lines long.

The goal is to get to the top-left corner of a randomly-generated maze. Once the goal is reached, the time taken to complete the maze is displayed, then the game restarts. At the beginning of the game, the player can choose either to have the maze stay on screen as it is explored, or to have only a small section of the maze displayed at one time.

sample_screenshots.caption: Exploring the maze with "Expose" mode on.
Completing that maze took us 30 seconds
Playing with "Expose" mode off. Only a small part of the maze is visible.
Upon reaching our goal, the screen flashes various colors.

title: Maze

description:
Paddleship is an action game created for the "NOMAM Basic Ten-Liners 2014" competition. The entire code, written in the Turbo Basic XL language, is 10 lines long.

The player controls a spaceship, and the goal is to reach another ship in a random location on the screen. The player's ship can only be moved via a paddle controller. The position of the paddle knob determines the speed of the ship's rotation, and pressing the fire button causes the ship to fly forward in its facing direction. There is a time limit, and once it is reached, the game ends and the score is displayed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Trying to fly the blue ship into the purple ship. It's really difficult.

title: Paddleship

description:
Shmup is a simple shooting game created for the "NOMAM Basic Ten-Liners 2014" competition. The entire code, written in the Turbo Basic XL language, is 10 lines long.

The player controls a ship flying to the right, with enemies randomly appearing from the other side, the more frequently the longer the game is running. The player can move up and down, and shoot lasers with the joystick's Fire button. Enemies are destroyed instantly when hit by a laser, and each destroyed enemy raises the score by a single point. Collision with an enemy ship takes away one life. When all lives run out, the score and progress is displayed, and the game can be restarted.

sample_screenshots.caption: Flying through space. We are the arrow on the left, the asterisks are the enemies.
Game over. The score is displayed. We made it just beyond wave 4.
Crashing into an enemy causes our ship to momentarily turn into random flickering letters as weird sounds play.

title: Shmup

description:
Slice is an action game created for the "NOMAM Basic Ten-Liners 2014" competition. The entire code, written in the Turbo Basic XL language, is 10 lines long.

The player controls a blue block moving around the screen, using a touch tablet (or paddle controllers.) Yellow squares appear at the bottom and fly up, and the goal is to catch the squares before they reach the top of the screen. Two bars at the top show the number of successfully caught yellow blocks, and the number of blocks which you failed to catch in time; when either bar reaches its maximum length (40), the game is over, and the score is tallied. A point is earned for catching a block, and lost for missing a block. Catching or missing 40 blocks results in a bonus or penalty of 100 points.

As the player catches the yellow squares, the background changes in color, and the rate at which the blocks appear increases.

sample_screenshots.caption: Beginning of the game. We control the blue square. We've already accumulated a couple of penalties (green bar.)
We've managed to catch 40 squares. The game ends, the score is tallied.
Some time later. The background has changed, and we managed to score some points as well (blue bar.)

title: Slice

description: Najeźdźcy z Kosmosu ("Space Invaders") is a clone of of Space Invaders, created with The Arcade Machine. The player's task is to destroy all of the alien space ships invading the planet. The player controls a cannon at the bottom of the screen and must destroy waves of moving from right to left alien ships, avoiding the falling missiles. Each successive level of the game introduces a new feature, such as safety zones, increased resistance of foreign vessels or controlled shot.

sample_screenshots.caption: You need to hit an alien a few time to kill it

title: Najeźdźcy z Kosmosu

description:
Tube Baddies is an action-arcade game for 1-2 players.

The Tubular underworld has become so run-down that all the pipework is decaying and full of holes. Now the "Big Inspector" is coming to check on the condition of the underworld. Bip and Bop have to patch the holes fast and before the inspector arrives.

You play as the handyman Bip (the second player plays as Bop) and it is your goal to defeat all the Tube Baddies by shooting your stun gun at them and deflect them into Barny the Bucket, who is at the middle at the bottom of the screen. The Tube Baddies will make holes in the pipes and new Tube Baddies will eventually come out of the holes, you can patch the holes by going over them and press the fire button. Occasionally, items will pop up, some are power-ups while others are power-downs (such as reversed controls). You also have to be careful not to go into the chewing gums, as they slow you down. After every two levels you will get a score screen, telling you how well you did.
title: Tube Baddies

description:
Ready to match reflexes with your Atari, mano-a-mano? Sports Illustrated lent its name to this early boxing simulation, which gives you an elevation of the ring and two boxers throwing three different punches. Matching your opponent's punch makes a block; each unblocked punch is a point. At least thirty head-shots in a round may earn you a technical knockout, but that's the only knockout available. Otherwise it's five to fifteen rounds, which at three minutes per round can give you a genuine endurance contest. Wear down a friend or just a single joystick, or allow the microprocessor to take both boxers. The footwork is simple, back-and-forth, but like in the real ring, probably the key to championship.

Score, rounds, and time are displayed large enough above the play window to let a quick glance tell you where you are, but your boxer will also grunt and drop his jaw each time he gets hit. If you see a lot of that, the bell will be a welcome sound, not to mention the thirty seconds' rest between rounds.

sample_screenshots.caption: Ding ding ding.... lets have a clean fight
Game start from your corners Round 1

title: KNOCKOUT

description:
Ucieczka z Z.S.T is a text adventure game. The player starts the game locked in the high school (Zespół Szkół Technicznych in Mikołów, Poland) and must find a way to escape. The only escape route leads through the closed front door.

The screen is divided into inventory part and descriptive text part. When the player arrives at a new location he may read a short description of the place, including possible exits, items and present individuals. The player may carry up to four items and wear clothes. The command follows a verb noun pattern or single verb orders. The game dictionary shows up after typing 'słówka' command.
title: Ucieczka z Z.S.T

description:
Wetlina '89 is a text adventure game, loosely following the events from Ucieczka z Z.S.T. The action takes place on a class trip to the Bieszczady Mountains in a small village in southeastern Poland called Wetlina. The objective of the adventure is to find items needed to write a letter home and a place to send it.

The screen is divided into inventory part and descriptive text part. When the player arrives at a new location he may read a short description of the place, including possible exits, items and present individuals. The player may carry up to four items and wear clothes. The command follows a verb noun pattern or single verb orders. The game dictionary shows up after typing 'słówka' command.
title: Wetlina '89

description: Błękitne Nimfy is a fantasy text adventure paragraph game. The objective of the game is it to free two sisters nymphs from the power of the terrible guardians - basilisk and dragon. The game consist of 64 paragraphs all together. The hero travels the world of the game by reading the following numbered paragraphs of the story. The choice of route is subject to either the player's decision or the random roll of the dice. Sometimes the choice is determined by possession the appropriate item.

sample_screenshots.caption: Story does not always ends happily

title: Błękitne Nimfy

description:
Jump!!! is a simple arcade game created for the "NOMAM Basic Ten-Liners 2014" competition. The entire code, written in the Turbo Basic XL language, is 9 lines long.

The player controls a ball which can be moved left and right. The screen is constantly scrolling upwards. The player must help the ball roll off the platforms and fall to lower levels before it ends up at the top of the screen. The ball must also be protected from falling off the bottom of the screen. When the game is over, the score is shown, and the player is congratulated if they got a new high score.

sample_screenshots.caption: Beginning of the game - blank screen
...or falls out the bottom of the screen
One of the endings - the ball ends up scrolled off the screen...

title: Jump!!!

description:
Roguelike is, unsurprisingly, a roguelike game, created for the "NOMAM Basic Ten-Liners 2014" competition. The entire code, written in the Turbo Basic XL language, is 10 lines long.

The player character moves around a randomly generated dungeon, collecting gold (which has no use) and fighting monsters of various strength. The monsters are represented by numbers which show how many hit points they have. The strength of a monster's attacks is proportional to its health. The player character can collect healing potions to restore hit points and scrolls that increase maximum health, as well as more powerful weapons that increase the maximum damage. However, monsters can steal items from the ground.

Each dungeon level has a staircase to the lower level, where more powerful monsters and weapons can be found. The goal is to get to level 8 of the dungeon.

sample_screenshots.caption: The stakes get higher as you get to later levels
A level is being generated. Wait patiently.
The penultimate level, with stairs (the "greater than" sign) just almost next to us

title: Roguelike

description:
2047 is a remake of 2048, created for the "NOMAM Basic Ten-Liners 2014" competition. The entire code, written in the Turbo Basic XL language, is 10 lines long.

The game takes place on a 4x4 grid and begins with one tile with the number 2. The player uses arrow keys to move the tiles, with a new "2" tile appearing after every move. When two tiles with the same number collide, they combine into one tile with the next power of two, e.g. two tiles with 16 will give a 32 tile. The goal is to get as valuable a tile as possible. The game is over if the entire board is filled.

Cavern 10 is a simplified re-interpretation of Caverns of Mars, created for the "NOMAM Basic Ten-Liners 2014" competition. The entire code, written in the Turbo Basic XL language, is 10 lines long.

The entire game takes 100 seconds to complete, and consists entirely of moving your ship left and right, steering it past obstacles and outcroppings in the rocky tunnel so that it reaches the end goal safely. Any collision causes a game over and forces the player to start over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Beginning of the cavern. All the items keep flashing white and orange.
Next section: avoid the missiles and ships

title: Cavern 10

description:
Dodge Racer is a simple arcade game, created for the "NOMAM Basic Ten-Liners 2014" competition. The entire code, written in the Turbo Basic XL language, is 10 lines long.

In the game, the player controls a car (represented by a single pixel) which must survive on a racetrack as long as possible, avoiding running into walls and into the single-pixel obstacles that keep rapidly appearing on the track. If, upon crashing, the player has scored a minimum of 800 points (10 points are gained for each obstacle that appears), he finds himself on a new, circular racetrack. The game keeps track of high score.

Version 1.1 of the game adds an on-screen score display, as well as score multipliers gained for making a lap around the entire racetrack. At first, each obstacle is worth 1 point; completing each lap increases this value and gives a large score bonus. The second level now requires 1000 points to access.

sample_screenshots.caption: Version 1.1 adds an on-screen score counter and a lap finish line (the blue dot on the left)

title: Dodge Racer

description:
Dratewka the Shoemaker is a text adventure game, based on the Polish folklore legend of the Dragon of the Wawel Hill. The protagonist of the game is a shoemaker named Dratewka who has to find a way to get rid of the evil dragon, living in the cave at the foot of the Wawel Castle mountain, terrorizing local residents and animals. The player wanders around a town and its surrounding landscape. He may collect items and use them at the appropriate places. Prior to the final meeting with the dragon Dratewka must prepare sulfur stuffed sheep.

The text in the game is supplemented by location graphics and directional compass. The player performs activities using text commands. Only one item can be carried at the same time.
title: Dratewka the Shoemaker

description:
Abyss is a trading strategy game, created for the "NOMAM Basic Ten-Liners 2014" competition. The entire code, written in the Turbo Basic XL language, is 10 lines long.

The end of the universe is coming. Of course, as a space trader, you are concerned solely with earning as much money as possible before the Armageddon arrives on day 1000. You can fly your ship around the galaxy, with 10 colonized planets, plenty of uninhabited planets, and black holes which keep appearing.

You begin the game with 150$ and with your cargo hold empty, except for fuel. Money can be earned by buying and selling various wares on the planets (but you can only sell wares to planets where there is demand), as well as by completing missions - get to a specified planet before a specified day to receive a cash reward. One of the wares - ore - can be also acquired by landing on uninhabited planets.

The ship's cargo hold has a limited capacity, but can be expanded for a hefty price. Flying around space consumes fuel; being low on fuel prevents you from mining ore, and running out of fuel causes a game over. Black holes are also dangerous, as they destroy parts of the cargo hold, and escaping them consumes a lot of fuel.

sample_screenshots.caption: Space. Letters are civilized planets, dots are uninhabited planets. Fuel counter, day counter, and the description of an available mission are displayed.

title: Abyss

description: War-Copter is an arcade game. East coast of the state is attacked by hostile country. Preventing full country invasion requires destroying the enemy naval base from which hostile ships and missiles are sent. Player's role is to protect the copter repair centre and destroy enemy base located on the far east. Limited resource requires scavenging debris from the sunk ships and altering them in own factories into ammunition. The fuel consumption depends on the amount of carried materials. The fuel may be resupplied on the base's grey pads.
title: War-Copter

description: Despatch Rider is a side-scrolling arcade game. The goal of the player is to make as much money as possible in twelve hours (from 7:00 till 19:00) by collecting packages from one part of the city and delivering them to the final customer. The main screen is divided into a map of the whole city with current weather, road window and indicators display panel (earned money, remaining time, remaining fuel). The rainy weather may affect the brakes' functionality, therefore speed should be adjusted to the conditions on the road. The player can refuel at one of the four gas stations in exchange for a fee. Fuel stations are shown only for two seconds each game. Crashing the bike into a kerb results in the loss of 30 minutes, crashing into a skip results in loss of carrying package. Collecting packages dropped from the window requires catching them before they fall to the ground. The package is delivered by throwing it through the open doors.
title: Despatch Rider

description: Zero Wars is a side-scrolling science fiction shooter. The game takes place inside a space station invaded by alien forms. As a space fighter pilot the player must destroy all the hostile aliens. The player uses gun sight to target enemies. After clearing corridor a container appears. Shooting container gives an extra object, such us: smart bomb, crystal, shield, rapid fire weapon. Missing container causes re-appearing aliens in this corridor. Achieving the next level requires collecting of three crystals. After each completed sector player receives a level password.
title: Zero Wars

description: Babel is an arcade two-player game, referring to the biblical story. The goal of both players is to reach as many stars as possible to outscore the opponent. The players lay the bricks that let them climb to the stars. Each touched star disappears after giving points. The game features 3 difficulty levels - first two start with built towers, last one starts at ground level, additionally the fall of the brick on the last two levels causes loss of all gained points! Random celestial events add extra stars in the sky and may result in lightning strike - if the player is hit the score plummets to 5 and he/she is knocked to the ground.
title: Babel

description: Strato Sphere is a second part of Excelsor. The action takes place five years later after first part of the series, on the earth's orbit. The player is a space bi-wing fighter pilot and must destroy 16 alien motherships surrounded by spherical shields and defense system. The ships are guarded by ghost-like soul suckers, patrolling the surrounding area. The fighter may sustain five hits of mothership cannons, meeting with the ghost means a certain death. The space fighter moves constantly forward, the player can only change the flight direction by turning the ship.
title: Strato Sphere

description: Excelsor is an arcade science fiction shooter. The action takes place in the Year 2136, after discovering Molecular transportation devices. Hostile alien race finds a way to separate souls from the body during the transportation process. The souls have changed into pure energy and are suspended in the space. The human bodies have become food for an alien race. Equipped with a laser gun with unlimited beams and Excelsior Prototype Jetpack the player must save the human race by shooting Soul Stars, Nexus Pulsars and Soul Suckers.
title: Excelsor

description: Monkey up a Tree is a simple educational game for kids teaching mathematical operations for up to two players. By giving the right answers the player must lead the monkey to the top of the tree, where the award is waiting - a fresh banana. The game contains all the four basic mathematical operations: addition, subtraction, division, multiplication.
title: Monkey up a Tree

description: Jumbo Jet Pilot is a flight simulator game, showing how to manoeuvre a massive passenger aircraft - Boeing 747 200B. The perspective is presented as a pilot's cockpit view with all the typical information. The player may use all standard aircraft features, such as increase/decrease throttle, brakes on/off, landing lights, undercarriage raise/lower, advanced map position. The game allows to train day and night flights.
title: Jumbo Jet Pilot

description: Reversi is a computer conversion of the popular two players board game Reversi, also known as Othello. The player may compete only against the computer with a choice of eight skill levels. The aim is to fill the board with as many pawns of your own color as possible by flanking the computer's black pawns (vertically, horizontally or diagonally) to capture them and reverse their color.
title: Reversi

description: Reversi II is a computer conversion of the popular two player board game Reversi, also known as Othello. The player may compete against the computer with a choice of six skill levels or against a human player. The aim is to fill the board with as many pawns of your own color as possible by flanking the opponent's pawns (vertically, horizontally or diagonally) to capture them and reverse their color.
title: Reversi II

description:
Thorn EMI Compute 4 & Reversi is a set of two puzzle board games for up to two players, with three difficulty levels:

  • Thorn EMI Compute 4 - where the player must drop tokens into a framework in such way to make a line of four tokens of one color;
  • Reversi - where the aim is to fill the board with as many pawns of own color as possible by flanking opponents pawns (vertically, horizontally or diagonally) to capture them and reverse their color.
title: Thorn EMI Compute 4 & Reversi

description:
This compilation includes four games:

  • Elektraglide
  • Fort Apocalypse
  • Timeslip
  • Drelbs
title: Atari Smash Hits Volume 6

description:
This compilation contains four games:

  • Elektraglide
  • Mediator
  • Chop Suey
  • Quasimodo
title: Atari Smash Hits Volume 5

description:
This is a five game compilation by English Software, containing the following games:

  • Jet-Boot Jack
  • Firefleet
  • Dan Strikes Back
  • Captain Sticky's Gold
  • Hyperblast!
title: Atari Smash Hits Volume 1

description:
This compilation contains five Atari 8-bit games packed for the UK market. The games are:

  • Jet Boot Jack (also contained in Atari Smash Hits Volume 1)
  • The Adventures of Robin Hood
  • Stranded
  • Diamonds
  • Citadel Warrior
title: Atari Smash Hits Volume 2

description:
A compilation bringing five Atari 8-bit games to the UK. The pack contains:

  • Jet Boot Jack
  • Aitstrike II
  • Batty Builders
  • Breath of the Dragon (the game was released only in this compilation)
  • Neptune's Daughters
title: Atari Smash Hits Volume 3

description:
A four game compilation including the following games:

  • Chop Suey
  • Fire Chief
  • Kissin' Kousins
  • Hijack!
title: Atari Smash Hits Volume 4

description: Přízrak nuly is an action arcade game. The player controls a little spaceship in a maze. His task is to find all 1-coins. He has to avoid floating 0 during the game as it costs him life. He should also avoid crashing into walls, houses or other objects. The map consists of 30 screens divided into 5 environments that differ in colour. Ludwig van Beethoven's Für Elise is used as music.
title: Přízrak nuly

description: Robot Karel is an easy side-scrolling arcade game. The player controls the eponymous robot and has to find a yellow oval in the game world. When he takes one, another appears. Player then has to find it and take it. When player finds the last one, the game ends. It is not always easy to get to the oval as not every way is not evident at first glance. It should be noted that the player character can't jump so he has to find places where can climb. Player has to avoid discs that end the game if the player touches them. To avoid these discs he can crouch.
title: Robot Karel

description:
Naturix is a platform game mixed with an adventure game. Player has to find four boxes and a navigation tool. His task is not easy as the game world is pretty large (124 screens) and full of enemies. Player can kill enemies with laser shots but there is a limited amount of them. There are also places where player has to solve logic puzzles, such as tricking the temperature sensor or how to get through flooded room.

The story is set in a Solar System far from ours. There is a planet Naturland where Naturixes live. There is a base on a moon of Naturland that provides power supplies. The player character is sent there for supplies just to find out that it is controlled by hostile beings which makes his task very complicated...
title: Naturix

description: The player controls a Soviet agent who infiltrated an American base and tries to destroy it. His task is to turn on a destruction system of the rockets in the base. To fulfill it he has to find the launching terminal. The task is not that easy as the base is a big labyrinth full of American soldiers. Enemies can be killed by shooting. Ammo can be bought in a shop but player can't spend much. There is a terminal in every room. It can be used to make contact with some people to gain information. Player has to get their number before contacting them. Some institutions or people can be contacted through a phone that player has to find. There are also characters that can be contacted only through Ministry of Defence terminal. In the end he has to find the Rocket launching terminal and hack it. Then he has to escape.
title: Nuclear Adventure or the North Base

description: Arkadia is a simple action game. The goal is to rescue people from the planet threatened by destruction. As a helicopter pilot the player must collect citizens from the buildings and transport them on a spaceship landing pad. The helicopter can take only one man.
title: Arkadia

description: Pająki is an action game for up to two players. The competition takes place on a single screen, where two spiders leave their spider's web behind. The duel finishes when one of the spiders hit the wall or the spider's web. After three winning duels the final score shows the time spent on board. The game allows to compete with human or computer player.
title: Pająki

description: Przekładanka is a puzzle solving game. The goal of the player is to move all digits from the first container to the last one in the same order by proper use of middle container. The blocks with a lower number can be placed on the blocks with a higher number. The player has access to a block which is currently at the highest level.
title: Przekładanka

description: Life is a simulator of living cell development. The task of the player is to arrange a proper initial pattern to find the best solution for the growth of living cells. After arranging the pattern the game shows the simulation of successive generations of cells until they necrosis.
title: Life

description: Pojedynek is a simple action game for up to two players. The game screen shows two duellists and continually reducing the distance. The distance has a direct impact on the accuracy of the shot. The winner is the cowboy who first hit the enemy.
title: Pojedynek

description: Inwazja is a simple shooting game. Using a small cannon the player must kill all the spiders falling on the spider's web from the trees before they reach the ground.
title: Inwazja

description: Wojenne ABC is an action educational game. The aim of the player is to shoot the indicated letter of the alphabet. The letters arranged in alphabetical order are constantly moving in one direction on the bar at the top of the screen. The player sees only a small part of the alphabet and to find the proper place he must use the fast right or left move and make a shoot within just five seconds.
title: Wojenne ABC

description:
Życie Maklera is a text based economic game. As a mine owner the player must keep as long as possible owned assets. The player may trade mines, sell ore and pay miners wages. Each mine requires ten employed miners. Miners payment affects the level of life and therefore the size of ore extraction. Every year the price of mine, ore and food is changing. Proper use of price trends is the key to wealth multiplication.

Życie Maklera is an unofficial port of C64/ZX Spectrum's game of the same title.
title: Życie Maklera

description:
Poszukiwacze is a puzzle solving game. The player competes with the computer in a search of a treasure. The treasure may be one of the five objects hidden in one of five different places. Alternating with the computer the player tries to guess what is the treasure and where it's hidden, by choosing a row (type of object) and a column (location) on a grid. The player has knowledge of four rows/columns where the treasure definitely can't be found, and the computer player has knowledge of four others. When choosing a spot the player chooses a grid square by pointing the intersection of the vertical and horizontal lines.

If the computer knows that the chosen spot isn't the right one (because it's in one of the wrong rows/columns known to the computer), the player is told so. Otherwise the player is asked if he wants to check whether the chosen location contains treasure. The player wins if he "checks" the location that contains treasure. The player loses if he agrees to "check" a wrong location, fails to "check" the right location, or if the computer finds the treasure first.
title: Poszukiwacze

description: Smok is an adaptation of the classical concept of snake games for up to two players. The player has to guide a dragon through a board. The player must feed the dragon with the randomly appearing spiders to score points, however feeding the dragon makes it grow longer. The later the dragon will eat the spider, the more points he receives. The dragon loses a life when he bites its own or opponent's tail, eats an obstacle in the form of a head or a ball (choking) or hit the wall.
title: Smok

description: Bitwa Morska is a computer version of the pen-and-paper Battleship game. The player competes with the computer by setting targets on the board. Hit shot means another attempt, missed shot means a loss of turn.
title: Bitwa Morska

description: Pole Minowe II starts after the emergency landing on an alien planet. Moving the Hektor robot the player must reach the exit teleport avoiding stepping on hidden mines. Hektor is equipped with an inaccurate mine detector. The detector sends a warning each time the mine is one field next to the robot with no direction indicated. Stepping on the mine destroys the robot. The game marks the route of the Hektor. The player starts with 20 grenades, which may be used to blow up obstacles, such as a wall or as a mine detonator.
title: Pole Minowe II

description: Pole Minowe II Edytor is a level editor for Pole Minowe II.
title: Pole Minowe II Edytor

description: Giełda is a text based economic game. Within one calendar year the player must earn as much as possible by trading on the goods exchange and playing on a slot machine. The game includes a built-in calculator.
title: Giełda

description: Koło Fortuny is a game based on the TV show Wheel of Fortune. The players take turns guessing letters to form a word or a saying. The game can be played with up to three human players. During their turn the players can spin the wheel, guess a consonant, buy a vowel or guess the password. The game is divided into three rounds, the winner of the last one may join the high score table.
title: Koło Fortuny

description: Pająki II is a light gun shooter. Using the XG-1 Light Gun the player must kill all the spiders falling on the spider's web from the trees before they reach the ground.
title: Pająki II

description: Odwracanka is a puzzle-board game. The player has to change all the black circles to the white ones. A selected circle changes the color to the opposite, along with the four adjacent circles (top, down, left, right). A black circle changes color to white, and white circle to black. There is no limit of moves allowed.
title: Odwracanka

description: Hektor starts after the emergency landing on an alien planet. Moving the Hektor robot, the player must collect all elements of the space ship scattered around the planet and reach the exit teleport. The task is complicated by numerous hidden mines and other deadly objects. Hektor is equipped with an inaccurate mine detector. The detector sends a warning each time the mine is one field next to the robot with no direction indicated. Stepping on the mine damage shield of the robot. The game marks the route of the Hektor. The player starts with 20 grenades, which may be used to blow up obstacles, such as a wall or stones and as a mine detonator. The mines may be found in various places, including hiding under other objects. The game features 32 chambers all together.
title: Hektor

description: Line Kiler is an arcade 'Light Cycle' game. The game allows two human players to compete on a single screen at the same time. Each player guides a line around the game board leaving a solid trail behind them. The main purpose of the game is to cause another player to crash into the trails, obstacles or the edge of the game area. The winner is the player who accumulates four wins in a row.
title: Line Kiler

description: This is a set of two action arcade games. In Pingwinek, a little penguin needs to collect various items scattered on the glacier. The task is complicated by numerous harmful lollipops. Contact with them means a loss of life. In Pingwinek Idzie do Szkoły, the player must safely carry a specified number of penguins from home to school. To do so it's necessary to cover a hole in the ice each time a little penguin is close by.
title: Pingwinek / Pingwinek Idzie do Szkoły

description:
Klony is a puzzle board game where the player competes with the computer. It is a clone of the arcade game Ataxx, with identical graphics (as much as monochrome graphics allow.)

The aim is to fill the board with as many own cells as possible. The cells can be moved two squares in any direction, including diagonally, or can be cloned by selecting the empty field next to our cell. By placing the cell next to opponent's cells, the player will take them over and change the genetic code to the opposite. The stage is finished when all empty spaces on the board are filled or after the destruction of all opponent's cells. The number of cells remaining on board decides who won the duel. A draw is impossible. The game features 60 levels altogether, each with a different location of the stone obstacles.
title: Klony

description: Parachute is a clone of a famous Nintendo's Game & Watch handheld game of the same name. The player controls a boat on the ocean full of sharks. His task is to catch all the paratroopers jumping out of a helicopter before they fall into the water.
title: Parachute

description:
Parachute Deja Vu is a clone of a famous Nintendo's Game & Watch handheld game of the same name. The player controls a boat on the ocean full of sharks. His task is to catch all the paratroopers jumping out of a helicopter before you fall into the water.

In fact this is the game Parachute, released a few weeks earlier, with fixed control system.
title: Parachute Deja Vu

description: LarkaNOID is a variant of Arkanoid. The player controls four paddles, each on a different side of the screen. Two horizontal and two vertical paddles move along at the same time. The player must deflect a ball upwards to hit a wall placed in the middle of the board to remove all the bricks and make the wall disappear.
title: LarkaNOID

description: ATASCII Squad is a side-scrolling shooter. Sixteen Years after the Great War with aliens the threat has come back. The intelligence gained information about the alien eggs hidden deep underground. The player as a fighter pilot must fly through hostile territory avoiding all obstacles to reach the ventilation ducts and throw inside a special destructive substance.
title: ATASCII Squad

description:
Klony 2010 is a puzzle board game where the player competes with the computer. The aim is to fill the board with as many own cells as possible. The cells can be moved two squares in any direction, including diagonally, or can be cloned by selecting the empty field next to our cell. By placing the cell next to opponent's cells, the player will take them over and change the genetic code to the opposite. The stage is finished when all empty spaces on the board are filled or after the destruction of all opponent's cells. The number of cells remaining on board decides who won the duel. A draw is impossible.

The game is an enhanced version of Klony, released in 2006.
title: Klony 2010

description:
Parachute 2011 is a clone of a famous Nintendo's Game & Watch handheld game of the same name. The player controls a boat on the ocean full of sharks. His task is to catch all the paratroopers jumping out of a helicopter before you fall into the water.

The game is an enhanced version of Parachute, released in 2008.
title: Parachute 2011

description: Octopus is a clone of a famous Nintendo's Game & Watch handheld game of the same name. The player controls a diver. His task is to pass under constantly moving octopus tentacles, steal the treasure and return to the boat.
title: Octopus

description: Mission: ArSoft is a labyrinth game. Controlling Bruce Lee the player must penetrate the headquarters of the ArSoft Corporation to capture a floppy disk with secret information. To gain the disk the player must find the keys (to open numerous doors) and four letters of a secret code (to decrypt the data). The number of the keys is limited. The keys must be used with caution, particularly as a number of doors hide a glowing diamond, distracting from the main purpose of the mission.

sample_screenshots.caption: Floppy disk with the secret data!

title: Mission: ArSoft

description:
Laser Chess is an unofficial enhanced port of Compute's Laser Chess, released back in 1987. It's a chess variant for two players. The goal is same as in traditional chess game - defeat the opponent's king. The gameplay is enhanced by a laser weaponry, although the players may choose the standard way of playing. The player may manipulate (by moving and rotating) all the pieces. There are eight types of pieces with special abilities, such as splitting or absorbing the laser beam. Basically most of the pieces are covered with mirrors reflecting the laser beam. Laser piece fires a laser beam in a straight line into a mirror piece placed opposite. The laser beam reflected by the mirror moves forward until it hits another mirror (including opponent's one), wall (beam disappears), absorbing piece (beam disappears) or destructible piece (including own one). The king and the laser have no mirror protection, some of the other pieces are protected only on the selected sides and the diagonal piece can't be destroyed by a laser beam, because all of its surfaces are reflective. The loss of the king means the end the game, the loss of the laser - the necessity of playing chess in the traditional way.

This version of the game features additional difficulty levels, enhanced sound effects and a limiting playing time clock.
title: Laser Chess

description: Numtris is a math based falling blocks puzzle game. The falling blocks here are single squares with single digit numbers written on them. The player uses the joystick to direct the left and right and the task is to stack them on top of each other so that the sum of the stacked blocks can be divided by ten (10, 20, 30 etc.). When succeeding with this the blocks are removed and the player scores depending on the size of the stack. The game goes on at increasingly higher speed until a stack reaches the top of the screen. Before a game the player can choose one of three difficulty levels that affect the speed of the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game is over when a stack reaches the top
More blocks, more sums to keep track of

title: Numtris

description: Alienbusters is a game similar to Battlezone. The player controls a tank whose task is to liberate the Solar System. The player has to find enemy objects and destroy them but enemy tanks try to prevent him from fulfilling the task. The player can shoot them with his cannon but immediately dies if they hit him. To find his targets, the player has to use his compass. Their coordinates are sent to the player during the game.
title: Alienbusters

description: Spy Master is a platform game, where the player (John), equipped with a pistol, must destroy a mysterious computer located in an extensive bunker, defended by numerous divisions of Nazi soldiers. Damaging the computer requires finding and using a floppy disk containing a virus, hidden in one of the many safes. Safes may be accessed after acquiring a proper code by hacking the selected terminals. John must use designated items to access selected areas. The game contains a few hidden mini games on the terminals, accessed by using the in-game "Spy DOS" via keyboard commands.

sample_screenshots.caption: X:8 Y:1 shows the spy position on the map

title: Spy Master

description: Xenon Raid is a 2D shooter, with little similarity to Galaga. The player controls a special vehicle placed on the road and fights against aliens. He must kill the various enemies and avoid attacks. The vehicle has limited fuel - to refuel the player must destroy several Xenons or destroy a special ship.
title: Xenon Raid

description: Fuzzy is 2D arcade shooter game, similar to Space Invaders, Galaga and many others shooters. The player controls a cannon (on the bottom of the screen - and he can move only left and right) and shoots "hairy" enemies. When he destroys all enemies, he goes to next level. The player has 5 ships, when he loses all ships - game is over.
title: Fuzzy

description:
The Jar Game & Chaos includes two educational games:

  • The Jar Game: The game presents the player with two jars which include a different amount of bonbons (green) and lumps of sugar. The player controls a fly and needs to enter one of the jars and land on a piece of sugar. The game's goal is to teach the kid to recognise which jar has the biggest probability of success.
  • Chaos: The player is presented with a field which contains a number of different shapes and colours. The game specifies a shape and colour and the player needs to catch as many identical items by moving a space ship over the field. During the game, the target may be changed.
title: The Jar Game & Chaos

description:
Herbert is a platform game where two players control ducks and race to be the fastest to a Stall. On their way to the Stall (and eventually to win the heart of their girlfriend), Herbert (P1) and his friend Oscar (P2) encounter bothersome obstacles such as witches, plants, thorns, and sword fighters. And they must also obtain gems to unlock the door to the Stall. But Herbert and Oscar cannot dally long - each level has a maximum time, and if that limit is reached, they're dead ducks (no pun intended)! Luckily, Herbert and Oscar can gain advantages by laying eggs in a nest (to get an extra life) and/or triggering temporary invulnerability.

There are 20 levels in this game. Best times, as well as high scores, are saved.
title: Herbert

description: Tecno Ninja is a sci-fi arcade game. As a ninja the player must reach the final chamber of each level and defeat the stage boss. Apart from running and jumping, the ninja may use fists to fight encountered enemies and destroy selected objects, which can hide a variety of useful items, especially keys, extra lives or coins. Keys are required to open the doors blocking inaccessible parts of the level. The number of keys equals the number of doors, therefore it is very important to find all the keys. This means basically the necessity of breaking all the objects and overcome adversaries. Energy deducted by encountered opponents and obstacles (electric barriers, spikes and others) may be supplemented by collecting energy boosters and extra life hearts.
title: Tecno Ninja

description:
Tecno Ninja: 25 Years Anniversary Edition is an enhanced remake of Tecno Ninja, released in 1990. It comes in a big box and contains: * the 5.25" disk for Atari 8-Bit

  • a 12 page full color instruction booklet
  • a wall poster
  • detailed maps for all 10 levels (100 screens)
  • a $5 discount coupon for the upcoming Tecno Ninja II release

The game was enhanced by adding a modern title screen and new music. The copy-protection from the original version was removed. The game was available in two versions: commercial with all the goodies mentioned above and freeware, as a downloadable atr file.
title: Tecno Ninja: 25 Years Anniversary Edition

description: Strzyga is an arcade game inspired by Montezuma's Revenge. The game requires being on the run constantly. Each board is haunted by three ghosts who come after just two seconds and start chasing the victim. Collecting objects (jars, masks, torches, swords, bombs) must be combined with a continuous avoidance of ghosts and numerous obstacles (spikes, snakes, cactuses, deadly plants). The main task of the game requires finding 100 jars, which allows access to the vampire guarding the treasure.

sample_screenshots.caption: Three masks in one place look suspicious

title: Strzyga

description: Perły Orcky'ego is an arcade game, where the player must find all pearls hidden in the Bitmor castle in order to save the planet from the evil Vikings. Gathering searched items involves finding the keys needed to open the door, avoiding birds and crushing devices. The main character can move in all directions, crouch and walk the ladders.
title: Perły Orcky'ego

description:
Captain Sticky has a big problem: He is all out of gum! To buy more, he requires gold which needs to be acquired by one of his crew mates. He puts on his diving suit and, controlled by the player, starts the search underwater.

The non-scrolling screen is shown from the side and is mostly covered by water. At the bottom of the screen are platforms on which gold bars randomly appear. The player needs to navigate to the gold bar and use a rope on them (which happens automatically by touching them) so Captain Sticky can retrieve them. After every gold bar, it is necessary to reach the surface in order to get a new rope (which also refills the limited air supply). Other obstacles are enemies (the player character carries a harpoon which can be used to get rid of some), deadly force fields, bombs dropped by helicopters and an overall time limit.

After collecting ten bars the player moves on to a new of the overall eight levels which loop with a higher difficulty after beating all. The first eight difficulty levels can be chosen before starting a new game and the 32K version has a highscore list.
title: Captain Sticky's Gold

description: Space Arena is a simple multiplayer-only game in which up to four players control little space ships inside a rectangular playing field. To score points, players have to shoot down the space ships of the other players. The game was specifically designed for use with paddle controllers. In 2014 the game got a little upgrade with support for the Multijoy interface. That version was titled Space Arena M4.

sample_screenshots.caption: The author gives some info about the game.

title: Space Arena

description: In Wkórwek the player controls a bouncing ball around a screen, filled with deadly obstables. The goal is to safely maneuver the ball into an indentation in the bottom right corner of the screen, which opens up the next level. Wkórwek made its debut on the "Deregeneracja Party 2015", a Polish Atari scene party.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game starts directly with level 1 w/o a title screen.

title: Wkórwek

description: In JawBreaker 2 the player has to remove all jewels from the screen. Jewels can be removed if two or more symbols of the same type are next to each other. The remaining jewels will fall down into the gaps created by the removed jewels. Removing jewels will also increase your overall score. JawBreaker 2 made its debut on the "Deregeneracja Party 2015", a Polish Atari scene party.

sample_screenshots.caption: The screen is still nearly full with jewels.

title: JawBreaker 2

description: Mad-Netter is a very simple 2D single-screen top-down arcade game. The player controls Mad Netter. He is in the meadow and wants to catch as many colorful butterflies as possible. He must avoid snakes, dogs and bees - enemies are black. The game has very simple controls - the player just moves the character on screen, he automatically catches butterflies.
title: Mad-Netter

description: Pacific Coast Highway is a Frogger variant that makes a few changes from the arcade original. The objective is still to guide an animal (here a tortoise or a rabbit depending on what instructions you read) across first a highway where various cars have to be avoided and then a river where the turtle has to jump between boats passing by. Unlike the arcade game, the road and river sections take place on different screens but are still considered a single level. Once both have been completed, the game moves on to the next difficulty level. From the second level, the sidewalk in the middle of the screen starts rolling. The game can be played by a single player or by two players simultaneously.
title: Pacific Coast Highway

description: Maze of Death is similar to Atari's Adventure (not the least visually) but has less puzzle solving and is more about collecting things and avoiding traps and enemies. The player controls an agent whose task it is to stop a cosmitron device from exploding. The device has become critical after a sinister scientist has removed it's radiation control cubes and the player has to retrieve a number of these (two to four depending on level) and put them back in the device. There is a time limit and if the cubes are not brought back in time everything will blow up. Making contact with various obstacles and enemies will also lead to failure. There are five difficulty levels which decide the time limit and which obstacles the player will come across. Enemies include roaming robots while traps include mines in dark rooms where sound is the player's only clue and lasers that randomly flash as the player passes through a room.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level 1 is completed when two cubes are brought back to the device

title: Maze of Death

description: Demon is a simple action-adventure game. The player moves through a maze, collecting one-use items along the way and using them in the right places, mostly to open underground passages. Movement is limited to walking, no jumping or ducking available. Contact with moving obstacles takes a certain amount of energy, which can be supplemented through the heart power up. The door opens by using the appropriate keys, campfire must be put out with a fire extinguisher and a wall with a dynamite stick.
title: Demon

description: The object of this game is to shoot down the various hostile planes that make their way across the screen in a series of waves, by aiming the crosshair at them and shooting them down using the joystick. The radar tells you which direction the planes are approaching from. You are encouraged to use a small amount of ammo, as you start each new wave with less ammo than the previous one. Five skill levels determine how fast the planes move and the amount of ammo available.

sample_screenshots.caption: Two planes flying past the crosshair

title: Fighter Pilot

description: Word Hanger is the computer version of the classic pen and paper game designed exclusively for the Atari 8-bit, and it is a 1-2 player game in which you have to guess a random word letter by letter. If you guess correctly, that letter will be revealed. If not, part of the platform or man will appear on screen. Get enough incorrect guesses and you will see the man hanged and the answer will be given out. For a two-player game, one player looks away while the other enters their own word (done by pressing the [Esc] key at any time during the game) and whoever looked away has to guess it.

sample_screenshots.caption: Took a few wrong guesses, and the gallows has been set up
You have turned into a skeleton

title: Word Hanger

description: Caterpiggle is an action arcade game set in a Pac-Man-like maze. Unlike Pac-Man this maze has no dots scattered around for the player to collect. Instead there are snakes moving around and the player's task as the titular creature is to eat them all. The snakes grow in size as the game goes on and if the player attacks one in the middle it will split and the two halves go in different directions.
