Like in Pac-Man there are guards, the Serpent Security Force, that are out to get the player. There are three of them roaming the maze and if they make contact with the player a life is lost. There is one way to take out the guards though. If the player eats a snake that a guard is touching, the guard too will get eaten. The game ends when all of the player's three lives are lost.
title: Caterpiggle

description: Time Bandit is a Snake variant where the player controls a worm called Herbie. The goal of the game is to eat all power pills in each level. When all pills have been eaten an exit opens up and the player can progress to the next level. For each pill that Herbie eats his body grows longer. In addition to the pills there are obstacles that the player has to avoid colliding with since that will cost a life. The same will happen if Herbie collides with his own long tail. After each level there is a bonus level where Herbie is joined by a second worm which is called Hank. Hank is out to catch Herbie and if he manages to do so the player will not get any bonus points. The game consists of 300 levels and an edit mode that allows the player to create an additional 100 levels.
title: Time Bandit

description:
Janosik wasn't afraid to stand against greedy nobles, avenging their cruelties done to simple folk living in Carpathian Mountains. When the evil baron Herburt found about Janosik's love - Maryna, he captured her and imprisoned her in his castle, hoping to lure Janosik to certain doom. It's up to player if Janosik will succeed in freeing Maryna and repaying the baron for this deed, or fail miserably - hanging on a hook.

The game world is divided into forest, village and castle areas. Our hero is armed with shepherd's axe, but he will find other items as well.

This platform game is loosely based on the story around Juraj Jánošík, a XVII / XVIIIc. Slovak highlander, leader of Carpathian brigands. In Poland the legend was revived by a popular TV series from 1970s, making him a fictional XIXc. gallant folk hero, who only robs the rich Austrian nobles to help oppressed local peasants, "Robin Hood way".
title: Janosik

description: The Great Return of the Penguins is an attempt to refresh the previous edition of the game, titled Pingwinek idzie do szkoły. The main goal requires carrying safely a specified number of penguins from home to another igloo within designated time. To do so it's necessary to cover (by moving joystick in a direction of referred arrow) a hole in the ice each time a little penguin is close by. The hole remains covered for only 3 seconds. Completion of the task requires sending a few penguins at the same time, starting and finishing in different igloos. Following the corresponding arrows and releasing the penguins at the right time is the key to complete the level.
title: The Great Return of the Penguins

description: Minotaur is a maze game based on the Greek myths about the creature that was fought by the hero Theseus. This game takes place before that though and the player takes control of a young Athenian that has to flee from the labyrinth without being devoured by the minotaur. The maze is randomly generated and is one screen in size. The player sees the maze from a top down perspective and starts out in the top left corner while the minotaur which is always visible starts out in the bottom right corner. The aim of the game is simply to reach the exit without running into the minotaur.

sample_screenshots.caption: Another maze with a different colour

title: Minotaur

description: Eoroid is a puzzle game, a clone of the Commodore 64 game of the same name. Each level is played on a 19x9 board, with some of the squares having blocks on them and others being empty. When the player selects a board square, its state changes, and so does the state of the eight squares surrounding it, similarly to a "Lights Out" puzzle. The goal is to remove all the blocks.

sample_screenshots.caption: After quitting the game, the score is shown
A game in progress. The colors are randomly picked each time.

title: Eoroid

description: 3D-Laby is a first-person maze game where the player is placed inside a randomly-generated maze and must find the exit (the wall marked with the letter "A"). The player can move from one square to another and make 90 degree turns. It's possible to bring up an overhead map of the entire maze at any time, by pressing Fire. Once the exit is found, the game congratulates the player and tells him how many steps he needed.

sample_screenshots.caption: We've found the exit, marked as A
The starting position is marked with an E
Title screen, level generation in progress

title: 3D-Laby

description:
Atari Aces is a compilation containing the following four games:

  • Zorro
  • Spy Hunter
  • Up'n Down
  • Tapper
title: Atari Aces

description: Golden Gloves is a boxing game viewed from a fixed side perspective. The game features single matches that can be played by one or two players or by two AI driven boxers. It's possible to choose between three and ten round matches and to impose a handicap on one of the boxers. The game is entirely played with joysticks where jabbing is done by pushing the button while hooks, blocks and ducking is done by pulling the stick. For each punch landed the player earns points. A normal punch is worth two points while a punch that forces the opponent back is worth five points. After a knockdown the player earns ten points and one point for every second that the opponent is down. If the opponent doesn't get up, the player will win the match.
title: Golden Gloves

description:
The goal is to collect all the keys on each level to open up the exit. This is a puzzle platformer game, and this is meant literally: the world has to be manipulated like a sliding tile puzzle in order to be able to reach the keys. Each tile is about one screen big, with floors where you can walk, and a number of exits.

Holding down the fire button brings up an overview of the level where you can manipulate tiles to join the appropriate corridors. Some places require tricky workarounds to be able to enter.

There are some hazards, like falling into a pit that joins to nowhere, or touching a cactus. These result to teleport you onto the starting point, but you have endless lives. The levels also can be accessed via a password system.

sample_screenshots.caption: Overview of the tiles of level 1

title: Ridiculous Reality

description:
In this homebrew top-down RPG tactics game, the action is controlled with a cursor, with which you can select the units.

Regarding the plot - an evil army has descended upon the land, bringing very hard, dark times. The king has been executed and his son is banished into prison since a decade now. Hope seems lost until someone frees the king's son and prisoners. It is time to claim back the land!

In-game, the first click reveals yellow tiles around the selected unit that tell where it can go in the current turn. The second click reveals brown blocks in proximity - these tell where or what can the unit attack. Click on a yellow square and the unit goes there. Click on a brown square and the unit may attack.

After you have done your moves, holding the fire button ends your turn and the AI makes its own. There are close range and artillery units, each one with different statistics like health, strength, shielding, speed. Lord units can make others stronger if they are nearby.

There are a variety of missions, like escaping from prison, open field battles, city siege, and more. Features include 23 levels, 26 different kind of units (swordsmen, bowmen, mages, catapults, beasts, etc), and a challenging AI player. Furthermore, there is a story line with cutscenes and dialogs, and a tutorial. Your progress gets saved automatically.

sample_screenshots.caption: Next level. Later levels are in much bigger scope.

title: His Dark Majesty

description: A Mario-style platformer game. You control a cape-wearing character in a colorful place presumably called Crownland. Avoid the hazards, stomp on the local wildlife, collect stars, and reach the far end of the levels. You can take 4 hits before losing a life.
title: Crownland

description:
A falling block puzzle game with an extravagant presentation. Differently arranged pieces (one at a time) are slowly falling into a pit, and you have to manage them around until they reach a stationary state at the bottom of the free space. When the tiles constitute complete rows, those rows disappear and you get points for it. If there are gaps in the rows, the pieces pile up, and the game ends if the pile reaches the top of the pit. There is a window that shows you the following piece. You can move the pieces horizontally, rotate them, or make them fall faster while holding the fire button.

Distinctive features are: There are some unusual pieces with 3 to 5 tiles. The game is separated into rounds. There is a meter that advances when you make complete rows, and the round ends when the meter reaches maximum. There is also a selection of tunes, and a randomly chosen one plays during the round. The graphics around the playfield uses an interlacing trick.
title: Getris

description: Horizontally scrolling shoot 'em up game. You have to manage your way trough the UFO-infested outposts on Jupiter's moons. The landscape is detailed and the passages are tricky. You can shoot, but the enemies move rapidly and take many hits.
title: Callisto

description: A vertically scrolling space shooter, using the GTIA graphics mode. You are inside enemy dreadnoughts, and you have to guide your ship to their core to destroy them. You have rapid firepower when holding the fire button down.

sample_screenshots.caption: Scrolling credits and score table under the title logo

title: Battle Eagle

description: This title is a spiritual sequel to the Amiga game Dimo's Quest. You are a frog that must collect all the sweets on the levels, and avoid the hazards. Various items have to be utilized to progress (colored keys, fire extinguisher, etc.). A separate level editor is also available.

sample_screenshots.caption: Same authors as for the Amiga original

title: Dimo's Quest in ABBUC Land!

description: Your task is to eliminate all robots in a level by deactivating their RGB components. To deactivate a component, shoot at the robot with a missile that has the colour you want to deactivate. For example, to deactivate a red robot, shoot at him with a red missile; to deactivate a cyan robot, shoot at him with a blue missile and than a green missile (or vice versa); to deactivate a white robot, shoot at him with red, green and blue missiles consecutively in any order. You can change your missiles' colour at the recalibrators or by picking up certain bonuses. There are 8 levels in the game with increasing width and complexity, including the single-screen introductory level 0. When you run out of energy, the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: I had no idea what I was doing at the time

title: RGB

description: A special edition of Operation Blood with Lightgun support Implemented.
title: Operation Blood for Lightgun

description:
Energy Czar is an educational simulation game where the president of the United States gives the player full power to guide the country through an energy crisis. The player has full control over eight energy resources: coal, oil, natural gas, uranium, hydroelectric power, solar power, wind power and biomass. It is possible to promote or restrict each resource, ration them, change their taxes and regulate their prices as well as changing environmental controls.

To keep the job, it is necessary to keep people happy and make enough energy available so that the demand is met. Failing to do so leads to the player being fired. A public opinion poll appears every five years and rates the player's accomplishments within three areas: economy growth, inflation and deaths from accidents and pollution. To stay in power it is necessary to get at least a 20% rating in each category and 30% overall. To win the game the player needs to get an approval rating of at least 75% and will then be given the title of National Hero.

sample_screenshots.caption: One way to lose the game

title: Energy Czar

description: Web Master is a single screen arcade game, where the player must avoid falling off the cobweb by repairing it. There are four spiders on a cobweb. The yellow one in the center is the owner, and the other three try to take his place. The intruding spider may be disposed by stinging it in it's tail. Spiders increase the speed by eating beetle or fly. The game allows to select one of three difficulty level (rookie, expert, world champion).
title: Web Master

description:
Bilbo is a close variant of Lady Bug (which itself is a Pac-Man variant). The player character, a garden gnome, finds itself in single-screen mazes and needs to collect all points by moving over them. Unfortunately there are also ghosts wandering around which try to touch the gnome - with deadly results. The main difference to Pac-Man are flap doors which change their orientation when passed. The ghosts can't use them.

An additional obstacle are stationary skulls which, just as the ghosts, mean instant death when touched. There are also bigger points which, if collected in the correct order, spell EXTRA and give a big score boost.
title: Bilbo

description:
Mar Tesoro (which is Spanish for Sea Treasure) is a game which simulates the search for sunken treasure. You start with $10,000 with which you must hire a boat, crew and equipment of various sorts from the main port of "The Island". Then you can explore and bring back any treasure that you find.

In port, you can hire a boat and select the type of equipment to use (scuba, diving rig or a diving bell). These allow you to reach treasure at increasing depths. You can also hire a historian who can estimate the worth of a treasure by a sample retrieved by the diver, without having to recover the entire treasure. Additional crew can be hired to assist in salvage operations. Once the daily hire charge and time has been determined, you can set out on your expedition.

On leaving port, you may choose to look at the chart which shows the randomly generated island, the surrounding sea, and previously dropped buoys. You can move the ship, represented by an asterisk, from square to square in four directions. Movement uses time, which is shown below the chart. If you exceed the agreed upon rental time you will be nabbed by the coast guard. Other randomly occurring incidents such as bad weather and engine trouble may also use time.

Once you have decided upon a spot to search, you may dive. This brings up a side view of the scene. You control the diver, who must visit the ocean floor and return a sample of any possible treasure. Treasure, which ranges from a shipwreck to an oyster bed with pearls, usually appears a different colour from the rest of the sea floor. It may also be guarded by a giant squid, which must be avoided, or you will lose a worker or perhaps your own life. Having brought the sample back to the boat, you have the option of retrieving the treasure. The historian (if you have one) will offer an opinion on the likelihood of a good treasure. The time it takes to retrieve a treasure depends on the depth. If you don't have enough time, you can mark the site with a buoy and continue elsewhere.

After returning to port, you are offered money for all of your recovered treasures. Then you may either leave the game (and get your final rating), or continue the game to look for even greater fortune.

sample_screenshots.caption: Found the coral. Now to retrieve it.
Map of "The Island". Zero days elapsed so far.

title: Mar Tesoro

description:
Laura is a side-scrolling arcade game. The story starts when Laura's grandpa dies, leaving her an adventure book with story about Taloc's Destiny Mask, allowing to control other beings. On 12th birthday, Laura decides to continue the mission of her deceased grandfather.

The goal of the game is to collect the appropriate number of masks in each stage in order to open exit door, while avoiding opponents and obstacles. Contact with them means a loss of energy or instant death. Reaching part of the locations requires finding a key, that will open the closed door.

The game features numerous types of various objects, enemies and elements, such as trap, wall, damaged wall, clay pot, machine, torch, spider, swamp, mysterious object, fire, tracker, pitcher, creature, guard, coin, radiator, ghost, creature, chest, potion vial, block, mask, key, bomb, door, water, expanding scrub. Every enemy has a specific feature, for example moving direction, walking on the tracks or firing poisoned arrows. Traps, enemies and obstacles may be neutralized with the help of various items.

Laura has only one life.

The game features 32 levels, cartridge version consists extra 32 levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Using block to avoid the laser beam

title: Laura

description: You control some kind of airplane flying over various landscapes and shooting at hostile objects that approach from the right side of the screen. There is a health bar and your weapon can overheat when firing rapidly. At the end of each level you have to destroy a barrier before you would crash into it.
title: The Extirpator!

description:
Twilight World is a platform game set in a dungeon. The aim is to reach the exit of each of eleven levels, while collecting crystals, keys for opening doors, and avoiding roving monsters or other obstacles. Contact with monsters results in your health-bar depleting, and when it is reduced to zero, then you lose a life. Extra lives are gained by exiting a dungeon, collecting 30 gems, or collecting all of the gems in a level. Energy can be replenished by collecting food items.

The player can walk left or right, or can fire a laser weapon which has a limited range. The player also has a gravity pod, activated by moving "up". This allows the players to jump any distance from a standing position, including between levels of the dungeon. Moving between levels causes all of the monsters to re-spawn. The player can duck by pressing down. Once per level, the player can activate a short-lived invulnerability mode, which also allows the player to fly (effectively using the gravity pod, while in mid-jump) and kill monsters on contact for about 10 seconds.

The game has two difficulty levels. The harder level requires all gems to be collected before leaving the dungeon.

sample_screenshots.caption: Needing to cross a moving platform.
The reward for winning is to start over.

title: Twilight World

description: Your goal is to jump up the rocks to reach the top of the mountain in the Alps. There are moving vines, ski lifts, earthquakes, winds, rushing water and more getting between you and victory.

sample_screenshots.caption: Last Level - Helicopter ladder to the rescue! This is accompanied by a really garbled, "Try the Next Level". Then you go up a difficulty level and get to do it all again!
Level 7 - Mining Carts, because why not?

title: Alp Man

description:
A war has broken out and pirates threaten to steal the food supplies of your colony. The colony has been supplied with three Armoured Defence Vehicles (A.D.V.s) that have the role of protecting it from the two large pirate space stations in orbit.

Gameplay is a classic fixed screen shooter and consists of moving the A.D.V along the bottom of the screen, shooting at pirate raiders and avoiding their projectiles.

Raiders can swoop down and snatch food from your stockpile. If all the food is depleted, a life is lost.
title: Colony 7

description:
Major League Hockey is an ice hockey game. The concessions in comparison with the real game are only four (instead of five) field players and the lack of referee interventions with the exception of the offside rule.

Two teams face against each other in a friendly. When the player has the puck, the available actions are to shoot towards the goal or pass to another player. Otherwise is is possible to either check the active enemy athlete or change the controlled athlete, either by automatically going to the one nearest to the puck or making an exact selection.

The available options are the length of the thirds (two, five or twenty minutes) and the strength of the computer AI in three steps. The up to four (two on Atari 1200XL) players can be freely divided between the two teams.
title: Major League Hockey

description: 07 Zgłoś Się: Collector's Edition is an unofficial commercial port of ZX Spectrum version, released back in 1993. The game was released on a cartridge, in a specially designed box containing communist-inspired manual.
title: 07 Zgłoś Się: Collector's Edition

description: 07 Zgłoś Się is an unofficial freeware port of ZX Spectrum version, released back in 1993. The gameplay and story remains unchanged, all graphics have been drawn from scratch, modeled on the original version.
title: 07 Zgłoś Się

description: New Adventures of Laura is an enhanced version of Laura, consisting of brand new 16 levels and extra two 3D stickers.
title: New Adventures of Laura

description:
The mad scientist Evil Otto has escaped into the past. You control a group of Robot Knights who have travelled back in time to hunt him down, before he can complete the monster he is creating.

Robot Knights is a platform game where you choose to control one of two types of knight. One carries a shield; the other a bow. The aim is to collect all of the objects (such as energy capsules) and defeat all of the fireball throwing creatures on the screen. The creatures may only be defeated by reflecting a fireball back at them. This may be done by blocking a fireball with the shield, or shooting it with the arrow. However contact with a fireball will reduce the player's energy, as will contact with one of the creatures. Once the player's energy is depleted, the game is lost. After each screen is completed, a door opens allowing the player to progress to the next room of the scientist's lair.

sample_screenshots.caption: About to escape from the first room.
There are a lot of undead here.
The knight dragging your entry into the high score list.

title: Robot Knights

description:
Beta Lyrae is a double star in the Milky way, the tail of which throws off a large body of gas, which has resulted in a number of habitable planetoids. These planetoids have been found to be high in a variety of heavy metals. Due to this, a large number of mining settlements and colonial outposts on these worlds. Now, a nomadic race has invaded these planetoids, determined to have the mining settlements to themselves. The colonists on these worlds live in fear, as the alien invaders will shoot them on sight.

As a Galactic Wing Commander assigned to the Beta Quadrant, you are part of a force committed to freeing the colonists from oppression. The player must fly over mountainous terrain, through alien caverns, and over cities. Eventually you must pilot your way into the cavern hosting the power supply of the alien settlements, and destroy the alien power supply. You must then exit the cavern and destroy as much of the fleeing alien forces as possible. Finally the player must navigate a complex asteroid field to reach the next infested planet.

This is a side-scrolling shooter. The player can choose from 5 difficulty levels, and can select the number of extra ships they begin with. The player will lose one ship every time they are hit. The player gets points for destroying alien installations, including: plasma cannons, lasers, alien power generators, alien command centers, alien outposts, attack missiles, and more.
title: The Tail of Beta Lyrae

description:
Aliens have invaded Earth, and it your job as a Nightraider pilot to destroy the alien menace. You must pilot your vessel across enemy terrain at night, avoiding their powerful land-based defenses as you lay destruction upon the occupying forces. Players must move quickly, warping in and out of hyperdrive to surprise their foe, and then laying destruction upon alien infrastructure with your powerful dual ion cannons.

You maneuver their ship left and right over hostile alien terrain. If you are hit by enemy fire you lose a life, and you start with a total of 3 lives. As you play, your ship will continuously lose fuel, which can be replenished by shooting alien fuel storage containers. Points are awarded for destroying alien structures and vessels, including: tanks, bridges, radar towers, saucers, train cars, missiles, space planes, fuel depots, and missile silos. At the end of each stage, the player must destroy an alien base. After this, they will progress to a more difficult level, where fuel depletes more rapidly. After defeating the first 5 stages and gaining the rank of commander, the player will gain an extra life

sample_screenshots.caption: Flying Over a Road and Forest

title: Nightraiders

description:
In Escape from Epsilon, you are imprisoned at the depths of five different caverns named Alpha, Beta, Gamma, Delta and Epsilon. You must survive the perils and escape to safety. Each cavern is made up of multiple screens and features a variety of perils.

The game is a side scroller platform game and the only ability the player has is to move left and right and jump over obstacles. The player must first find a key and then reach the door to escape the level.
title: Escape from Epsilon

description:
The citizens of Zorel 6 are under embargo by the Galactic Council. All trade goods created by the people of Zorel 6 must pass inspection by the Orelian Guards, and only those goods deemed necessary for galactic security are allowed to pass outside the planet. All other items are dispersed to the Council's burgeoning warehouse. To enforce this action, a massive interstellar fleet has positioned itself over Zorel 6, closely monitoring the movement of all goods. You play as a smuggler, who must sneak between the patrolling Galactic fleet, evade a patrolling robot ship, and attach yourself to cargo before it reached the Council warehouse. You must then deliver the cargo to an awaiting Vorox transport ship high above the blockade.

The player must complete progressively more difficult levels featuring more advanced enemy patrols. Players are awarded points based upon which cargo they recover, and gain an additional ship for every 5000 points gained. Stage 1 requires recovery of 8 pieces of cargo, and each progressive stage requires 2 more pieces. The player must recover all pieces before they run out of fuel, or they crash. The player will lose a shuttle if they strike any enemy vessel, a building, or are shot.
title: Embargo

description:
In Candy Factory you play as a piece of round candy that must bounce his way to progressively higher rooms in a candy factory.

Rooms consist of individual platforms and ladders, and the player must climb to the top of each room to the ladder which leads to the next level. There are bonus candies that can be picked up, but they are not necessary for reaching the next level. There is a bonus counter in the top right of the screen that continuously ticks downwards. The player starts with 5 lives, and if the timer reaches 0, the player will lose a life. The player must avoid threats including: floating faces, smashers, and bricks falling from higher up in the factory. If the player falls from any height, even 1 pixel, they will lose a life.

After ascending 9 rooms, the player will reach the top of the building, where they must catch a balloon and float to safety. They will then restart at the beginning of an identical tower with palette swapped floor tiles.
title: Candy Factory

description:
You play as the bacterial Andromeda, which has successfully invaded a multi-cellular organism. Your goal is to stay alive as long as possible, by avoiding the surrounding organism's immune system. While inside the organism, your goal is to eat as much tissue as possible, consuming fat cells, blood vessels, and even mutant cells. For every 5000 points consumed, the bacteria will increase in size. It can even enlarge to destroy the immune system cells which seek to eliminate it. Fat cells will regenerate slowly, but arterial vessels will heal immediately, thus preventing arterial bleed.

There are a total of 7 difficulty levels of play. At higher levels, the immune system will attack sooner and more frequently. The player starts with 3 lives, and if all are lost, it's game over.
title: Andromeda

description:
In Pathfinder, your job is to clear a large scrolling maze of the radioactive waste strewn about. Complicating this, radioactive creatures will attempt to stop you. The player moves and fires in 8 separate directions. You are armed with two types of shots: Regular plasma blasts, as well as fire retardant shells which can be picked up at a fire station. Only fire retardant shells can eliminate radioactive fires. A level is completed by removing all radioactive waste, and a counter in the bottom of the screen tracks how much waste and enemies are remaining.

There are 3 types of enemies. Nuke, who absorbs power from nuclear waste. Nuke follows the player, and can only be destroyed when enough radioactive waste has been cleared. Phantom, who moves incessantly in a straight line. Phantom moves through walls with ease, but bounces off the outer rim of the level. Minelayer, who moves throughout the level placing mines. If the player shoots a mine, it will start a fire, which can spread through a level.

There are a total of 15 different difficulty levels. At higher levels, fires spread faster and enemy creatures move faster. The player has a total of 3 lives per level, and if they are struck by enemy creatures they will lose a life.

sample_screenshots.caption: Exploring Level 1 - A Fire Station and a Minelayer Are Present
Level 15 - More Waste and Walls Are Deadly

title: Pathfinder

description:
Match Racer is a 1 to 2 player overhead racing game. The player must navigate numerous racing challenges, including: bridges, chicanes, barricades, narrow roads, and boulder fields. As the game progresses, the speed of the vehicle increases, making the game more challenging. In 2-player mode, vehicles can collide with each other, and players can work cooperatively, or try to push their opponent off of the road. Dirt, water, and oil slicks can cause vehicles to lose control. If a player hits any solid object, their vehicle is destroyed.

In 1-player mode, the player starts with 3 cars. In 2-player mode, each player starts with 5 cars. Points are rewarded for distance traveled, and every 100 points rewards an additional car. When all cars are lost, it's game over.
title: Match Racer

description:
Galactic Chase is a Galaxian variant. The player controls a space ship with a simple task: kill all alien invaders. The ship is restricted to horizontal movement on the lower part of the screen - while the enemy formation sticks to the same movement pattern, occasionally one or more ships break out and attack the player directly. If they (or one of their shots) hits the player ship, one of the three lives is lost. Additional lives are earned after 7000 points are earned or after a set amount of levels is passed.

The goal of the game is to achieve a high score; the four kinds of enemy ships give a different amount of points. When they are attacking, their point worth is doubled. The three difficulty levels can be set before beginning a game or it automatically increases after ten levels have been finished. Level two makes enemies faster and level three your own shots slower. Multiplayer is a high-score comparison.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Level is Shown by the Number of Flags in the Bottom Right

title: Galactic Chase

description: Moogles is an arcade game where the goal is to guide the eponymous moogles to the single exit of a maze. The moogles will follow the arrows placed within the maze, and the player must quickly rotate these arrows to guide the moogles. If two moogles come in contact, then the player loses a life. The player is awarded bonus points based upon how quickly they can free the moogles from a maze. Later levels have moogle tunnels, which allow the creatures to cross paths without coming in contact. On higher levels, moogles will move faster, increasing the challenge. The player starts with 3 lives, and if these are lost, it's game over.
title: Moogles

description: Video Poker is a Quick Assembler conversion of American Poker released back in 1994 in Basic. You make separate bets (10 up to 100) on the deal and draw. You receive your initial 5 cards and can form automatic wins on the deal. You can either choose to take a win, or refuse the win and hold specific cards while placing an extra wager. After receiving your hand, you have two options: hold cards and make an extra bet during the draw round, or deal without betting. Once the round is over, you can start a new hand by clicking the deal button. The stake for the card arrangement is displayed in the table. The game ends after losing all the money.
title: Video Poker

description: American Poker is a card video game written in Basic, based on American Novomatic Poker®. You make separate bets (10 up to 100) on the deal and draw. You receive your initial 5 cards and can form automatic wins on the deal. You can either choose to take a win, or refuse the win and hold specific cards while placing an extra wager. After receiving your hand, you have two options: hold cards and make an extra bet during the draw round, or deal without betting. Once the round is over, you can start a new hand by clicking the deal button. The stake for the card arrangement is displayed in the table. The game ends after losing all the money.
title: American Poker

description:
In Bug Off!, your garden has fallen into a Florida sinkhole, and the insects within have mutated into beasts of destruction. Armed with only a sprayer can of DDT, you must defend yourself from these rampaging insects.

The player controls a chemical sprayer, which can be moved on all four outer edges of the gameplay window. The sprayer will always point towards the center of the screen, where your garden resides. Insects will randomly stream out of the garden, and you must kill them by spraying them with DDT. Every 3 rounds, night will fall, and the army will drop you two new cans of DDT. There are a variety of insects encountered. Moths are harmless, but will try to form cocoons on the edge of the screen, blocking your spraying. Cocoons can be destroyed, but not if they're formed in the corners of the map. Bees attack in force, and prevent your spray from reaching more deadly bugs. There are also insects that will inhabit the corners of the screen, and will destroy the player if they come in contact. At night, butterflies appear, which reward the player bonus points for every corner that has remained free.

When the player is hit, they will lose their current can of DDT from their sprayer, and a second can will be thrown to the center of the garden, destroying all bugs on the map. Although the player starts with 6 cans of DDT, they in reality have 3 lives. When all lives are lost, it's game over.
title: Bug Off!

description:
Preppie II features the continuing adventures of Wadsworth Overcash. Up and coming prepester Wadsworth thought he had it all, until an initiation stunt gone wrong left him in trouble with the top fraternity on campus. After barely escaping his banishment retrieving balls from a golf course of hellish design in Preppie!, Wadsworth must now compete in a new challenge to advance to the next level of fraternity consideration.

Wadsworth is armed with a cloak which makes him invulnerable to enemy attack for a limited period of time each level. Each level of difficulty consists of 3 rooms separated by a doorway. The goal is to walk over all areas of the map to turn them purple. When all squares are colored in all 3 rooms, the player advances to the next level. Room 1 and 3 features frogs which continuously try to hop towards the player. They can be avoided by using spinning doors to block the frogs' path. The 2nd room features several horizontal passageways, from which lawnmowers continuously scroll from the left or the right. The player must use interconnecting pathways to avoid this danger.

Between levels, players are treated to a brief intermission involving an alligator. After each level, the dangers move at a faster rate. The player has a total of 3 lives, and if all are lost, it's game over.
title: Preppie! II

description:
Wombats I: Gazumba The Great & The Wombats of Borozoa is a parody text-based adventure game for 8-bit Atari systems.

The player inputs commands via VERB NOUN statements. The player enters a bizarre world consisting of strange beings, killer vegetables, dim-witted robots, suggestive statues, weird happenings, outrageous puns, and general absurdity. Set in the remains of a college campus, the player's goal is to gather nine treasures strewn about the campus, and return them to their starting location. The player is furthermore rewarded bonus points for completing specific tasks during their adventure.
title: Wombats I: Gazumba The Great & The Wombats of Borozoa

description:
Somewhere between Never Never Land and next Thursday lies a jungle orchard of fruit ripening beneath the peppermint sun. It's the perfect place for the “Hungry' to gobble up fruit, but care must be taken to avoid the killer bugs which infest the orchard.

Tutti Frutti is a 1 - 2 player game, where the player controls a set of jaws whose goal is to gobble up fruit. Each stage contains different fruit, trees, and intermittently spawning bugs. The goal is to eat all the fruit within the allotted time, by moving overtop the fruit. Trees merely create barricades to movement. Killer bugs will spawn, and follow the player for a limited time period. If they contact the player, a life is lost. If the player eats all the fruit, they will advance to a more challenging stage.

The player starts with a total of 3 lives, and when all are lost it's game over. The player has options to control the speed of the bugs, and the forest thickness at game setup.
title: Tutti Frutti

description:
Sunday Golf is a simple 1-4 player golf game which contains one 18-hole golf course.

Utilizing a birds-eye view of the golf course, the player chooses their club and the direction of their shot. The choice of club has no effect on a swing other than distance, and all shots go straight in the direction prescribed, with no wind or other factors affecting play. Hazards including sand traps and water are present.

When the player lands a ball on the green, gameplay shifts to a 2-dimensional side-view, where the player must select a shot strength between 1 and 50. Greens have hills, which can influence how much strength is required, and the player will overshoot the hold if too much strength is directed. Score is maintained throughout all 18 holes.
title: Sunday Golf

description:
Angle Worms is a two-player arcade game.

Both players control a continuously moving and elongating worm. The two players compete on a screen with multiple obstacles to see who can grow the longest worm. If the player comes in contact with an obstacle or a piece of an elongating worm, they lose the match. The longer a player survives, the more points they get for winning that match. Each player gets a limited number of shots, which can be used to shorten a worm if they cut off their own tail. The game ends when one player reaches the predetermined score at the beginning of the match.
title: Angle Worms

description:
Jantor is the name of the harsh and desolate planet that lies half in this dimension, and half in another. The strangeness of this shadow world is a result of the presence of large quantities of tricasmium; a rare ore with subtle and unusual properties. A Rigillian fleet has been sent to conquer Jantor, and only your Space Hornet interceptor can stop it.

Shadow World is a mostly side-scrolling shooter, ala Defender. Rigillian crystal ships slowly descend from the sky, and can only be defeated by having their central core destroyed using your interceptor's plasmatronic cannons. These crystal ships deploy a skimmer, which retrieves tricasmium from the surface, allowing the ships to descend safely. They also deploy guardian drones which act as escorts. Once a crystal ship reaches the surface of the planet, it becomes a colonizer and impervious to weapon fire. The colonizers can only be inactivated by picking up a tricasmium nugget and then flying over the entrance of the colonizer.

Your interceptor is armed with a small number of smart bombs, which obliterates enemies on the screen and returns you to your base. Successful destruction of each waves of ships rewards you with another smart bomb. Armed with cannons and these bombs, you must prevent five active crystal ships from landing, or the entire planet will be sucked into a temporal vortex.

sample_screenshots.caption: A colonizer has landed near this waterfall.
About to collect some tricasmium ore.

title: Shadow World

description:
The Nightmare is a black and white horror-themed adventure game with light RPG elements.

Played from an overhead perspective, the player finds themselves trapped within a 4-story haunted mansion, which represents the horrors within their own subconscious. Gameplay is entirely via joystick, and the player must maneuver around the castle to gather items to power up their character, including: a glistening silver cross, a magic book, a powerful staff, and a magical ring. As well, they must collect keys to unlock the many doors through the castle. The ultimate goal is to retrieve their mind's eye, located within the Tunnel of Death, and return it to the iron door which slammed behind you when first entering the twisted world of the subconscious. The player has an 8-hour time limit, representing a full night's sleep, to escape the castle still alive.

The game contains a combat system, and the player is warned when enemies are nearby. Monsters present on the map will move incessantly towards the player. When the player is engaged, they can choose to either flee or enter combat. The game rolls a random damage value for the player and monster based upon items collected and power-ups discovered. Battle success is based upon when the player stops the random dice roll.
title: The Nightmare

description:
King Arthur's Heir is a black and white fantasy-themed adventure game with light RPG elements.

After accomplishing many great feats of chivalry, you have risen to become the right hand of King Arthur of the Britons. He has declared you his heir over his own relative Mordred. To prove yourself worthy, you must locate the Scroll of Truth, which has been hidden by the wizard Merlin, and return it to Camelot. Played from an overhead perspective via joystick, the player explores the medieval British countryside. The player can visit various British towns, and must collect gold and other resources to become more powerful. Various enemies including dragons, the Devil, the giant Gogmagog, the Black Wizard, and others will attempt to stop your progress. The player receives regular updates on their time and progress through this journey.

The game contains a combat system, and the player is warned when enemies are nearby. Monsters present on the map will move incessantly towards the player. When the player is engaged, they can choose to either flee or enter combat. The game rolls a random damage value for the player and monster based upon items collected and power-ups discovered. Battle success is based upon when the player stops the random dice roll.
title: Quest for Power

description:
Escape from Vulcan's Isle is a fantasy-themed adventure game with light RPG elements.

A navigator of great renown, you are swept up in a tropical storm, and shipwrecked upon an uncharted volcanic isle. Exploring a nearby cave, you discover the diary of Alcemnon, a sailor who perished years before. The pages speak of magical artifacts and frightening creatures present on the island. Played from an overhead perspective via joystick, the player must explore the deep caverns and volcanic crevices of Vulcan Isle. The player must gather items to aid their escape from the island, including: a magic flute, a cloak of invisibility, and powerful spells. A lone village on the island can sell resources to the player. Various enemies including flesh-eating Harrises, limb-wrenching Satyrs, and Winged Demons haunt the island to prevent escape. The player receives regular updates on their time and progress through the journey.

The game contains a combat system, and the player is warned when enemies are nearby. Monsters present on the map will move incessantly towards the player. When the player is engaged, they can choose to either flee or enter combat. The game rolls a random damage value for the player and monster based upon items collected and power-ups discovered. Battle success is based upon when the player stops the random dice roll.
title: Forgotten Island

description:
Dr. Goodcode is occupied with new and grand pursuits. Thus, he has commissioned you with cleaning out the monster infestation in the basement of his mansion because since moving into the mansion one year ago, they have continued to interfere with his research. The basement of the mansion was once of grand design, with each room painted a different color, and designed by some of the greatest architects of the age. Home of the great wizard Johnny, the wizard did not trust banks, so had created a menagerie of monsters to protect his significant wealth. You have answered Dr. Goodcode's call for an exterminator, and must plumb the depths of the dungeon to destroy all the monsters within.

Dr. Goodcode's Cavern is a text-based RPG, where the player must explore a number of rooms with differing text descriptions. The player can find gold and other items as they explore. Each room is numbered, and a compass shows which room lies in which direction. They will intermittently encounter monsters, which can be either bribed, attacked, fled from, or zapped. Bribing uses up gold. In combat, the player and monster take turns striking each other, where damage is determined by your character's strength and equipment. The character levels up as they are victorious in combat. The zap ability can only be used 3 times per game, but will instantly kill any monster. The goal is to hunt down and destroy all monsters within the dungeon.
title: Dr. Goodcode's Cavern

description:
Deflection / Simon Says is a compilation of two games for 8-bit Atari systems.

In Deflection, a bouncing ball moves about the screen. The player can redirect its movement by pressing the "/" key, which creates a slanted border which redirects the ball's movement. The goal is to collect the icons spread throughout the screen, by directing the ball onto their location. The player's score is based upon the number of bounces and borders required to collect the icons. The ball can become lodged in the far corners, creating an unwinnable situation.

Simon Says is a memory game, where the player must remember a sequence of flashing lights labeled 1 to 5. Every 4 turns, one more light flashes, creating an increased difficulty level. The game ends when the player has incorrectly remembered 3 sequences.
title: Deflection / Simon Says

description:
Chicken is 1 or 2-player arcade game for 8-bit Atari systems.

The player controls a small chicken with a cart at the bottom of the screen. A fox-like creature at the top of the screen will randomly place eggs upon a conveyor belt from the egg stash in the top left corner. These eggs will then fall through the conveyor belt, and the player must catch them in their cart by moving horizontally. There are a total of 15 egg drops per level, and after 15 drops the player moves to a harder difficulty level. If the player drops an egg, the farmer comes and takes their cart, and the player loses a life. If 3 eggs are dropped, it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Farmer Carts off my Eggs

title: Chicken

description:
The Omega Peace Accords have been violated by the Plexarian Invincibles. Their bio-Transporters have warped into Earth's atmosphere, with the plan of dripping ooze from high up in the atmosphere into the Earth's seas. This ooze will raise the levels of the oceans, drowning out all life, so the Plexarians can overtake the planet. The Terran alliance has hastily created Gamma-Tube Absorbers in the Sargosso Sea, which can nullify the invading slime. You must use the Earth's Electro-Wedge Deflector warships to reroute the slime into the Absorbers to protect the world's seas.

In Slime, the player controls a small warship, which moves horizontally on the bottom of the screen. It is surrounded by an Absorber on either side of the bottom of the screen. Alien vessels will drop slimes from the heavens, and the player must shoot out wedge-shaped barricades, with the hope of directing slimes into the Absorbers, or at least preventing them from reaching the sea. While doing this, alien spaceships will intermittently plug your Absorbers, or shoot down your wedges. As slimes reach the ocean, the sea level will rise, and when the seas reach the top of the screen, it's game over.
title: Slime

description:
Wall War is a 1-player versus computer arcade game for the Atari

The player controls a small robot, which is separated by a 4-layered, multicolored, moving wall from an opponent. The player can move horizontally, and can fire shots vertically towards their opponent. Intermittently, laser shots will shoot from the turrets horizontal to the player, and push them to the left or right. Once the wall is destroyed, the player injures their opponent by placing shots in the multi-color field behind them, causing the field to drain. When the field is drained, the player loses.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Wall is Receding. You can See Laser Cannons Firing

title: WallWar

description:
Golf Challenge is an 18-hole arcade golf simulation for the Atari.

The player controls a small character, whom they can position anywhere on the field of play. The character has a single golf club, which can swing in a 360 degree arc. The power of the player's swing is based upon how far of an arc the club goes through prior to connecting with the ball, and the direction of the swing is dependent upon the angle the club connects with the ball. There are a total of 18 holes, which contain basic hazards including trees, sandtraps, and water. When the player places the ball on the green, the player enters a zoomed-in view of the putting green, but still positions and swings their club in the same manner. The game keeps track of the score through 18 holes.
title: Golf Challenge

description:
Bishop's Square and Maxwell's Demon are a series of two single-player games released for the Atari system.

Bishop's Square is a tile-sliding puzzle game. A picture is split into a number of separate tiles, from 4 - 64, and randomly shuffled. The player must restore the individual photo by sliding the rows and columns of tile pieces. Initially came with 3 photos: deer, cube, and desert. The game tracks the number of moves made to solve a puzzle, and the player can save a puzzle in progress.

Maxwell's Demon is based upon the second law of thermodynamics, but in this case the goal is to prove it wrong. The player controls James Clerk Maxwell's imaginary demon which sits upon the gate of separation between two molecules, by attempting to separate a system of fast moving hydrogen and slow moving helium atoms by opening and closing a gate that separates two chambers. The gate can be moved vertically, and can be briefly opened to allow molecules through. The goal is to separate all the atoms in the system.
title: Bishop's Square / Maxwell's Demon

description:
Jeepers Creepers is an arcade game for the Atari 8-bit system.

The player controls a small insect which must travel around the lines of a board trying to fill in all the squares. Hunting the player are yellow wasps, which if they catch the player, causes them to lose a life. If the player surrounds an insect square, a wasp-eating beetle will be released which will hunt down some of the wasps which chase the player. When the player surrounds a key, it transports them to a random level. When the player has filled in all boxes on a level, they advance to the next level. The player has a total of 3 lives, and if all are lost, it's game over.
title: Jeepers Creepers

description:
Tari Trek is a 1-player Star Trek themed turn-based strategy game for the Atari 400/800.

The player controls the USS Enterprise, as they travel through a large 8 x 8 galaxy map to destroy all Klingon warships. All commands are via text input, and there are a total of 9 different difficulty levels. The player's goal is to warp between sectors to find and destroy enemy vessels. The player is armed with phasers and torpedoes to engage Klingon vessels, and will also take ship damage from alien vessels during battle. The player has limited energy to travel and engage in combat, as well as a limited time period, and if either are depleted, it is game over. Thus, the player must carefully manage travel times versus energy cost, as well as the time and energy spent engaged in battle and repairs in order to destroy all Klingon vessels.
title: Tari Trek

description:
Race in Space is a 2-player space themed racing game for the Atari 400/800.

2 players individually control a small spaceship, which has the ability to go forwards and backwards. The goal is to reach the top edge of the screen, while avoiding meteorites which fly in from the lateral directions. If the player is struck by a meteorite, they return to the bottom of the screen. For every lap cleared, the player is awarded one point. The player with the most points at the end of an allotted time period is the winner. The players can control several aspects of the race, including: gravity level, the color scheme, whether the players are represented by rockets or saucers, and the presence of comets as hazards.
title: Race in Space

description:
Shooting Gallery is a 1-player shooting game for the Atari 400/800.

The player controls a small gun, which moves horizontally on the bottom of the screen. The player has a limited number of bullets, which are represented in the bottom left corner of the screen. The goal is to maximize points in a single round, by shooting owls, rabbits, and ducks. The player receives 60 points per item in the back row, 40 in the middle row, and 20 in the back row. Ducks will intermittently take flight, and if not shot immediately, will gobble up the player's bullets. There is a small row of pipes in the top of the screen. The value of these are based upon how many shots the player has taken in that game, decreasing by 10 points per bullet used. Stars and targets will appear on the screen, which reward the player with more bullets of shot, but are not worth points. A game is over if the player runs out of bullets or all items on the screen are shot. If the player shoots all items on the screen, a bear appears, which can be shot for bonus points.
title: Shooting Gallery

description:
Star Sentry is a 1-player space themed arcade game for the Atari 400/800.

Suddenly the small ice planet planet Thule is surrounded by alien life orbs determined to change the hostile environment to suit their own needs. Unfortunately, you are stationed in a small outpost build atop an icy peak, and will certainly be destroyed as the ice melts. You must destroy the aliens before they melt your frozen home.

A 1 player horizontal scrolling shooter, the player controls a small spaceship which can move in all 4 cardinal directions. The ship has a small cannon, which can only fire horizontally forwards. From the right stream alien space orbs, and at the bottom of the screen constantly changing rocky ground poses a navigational hazard to the player. The player's goal is to maximize score by shooting alien orbs, which take 3 hits to be destroyed. There are a total of 9 difficulty levels. The player has 3 ships, and when all are lost, it's game over.
title: Star Sentry

description:
Thunder Island is a 1 - 2 player maze game for the Atari 400/800.

Somewhere in the South Pacific, about a thousand miles off the coast of New Zealand, lies an island that contains the world's only transparent maze. This maze can be manipulated into an endless variation of different paths and puzzles. Unfortunately, this area is subject to sudden storms, which can plunge the maze into darkness. Armed with only a small lantern, you must navigate this maze racing a timer or another player.

The player controls a small square, which must navigate a large maze. At the beginning of each stage, the maze is displayed for the player to try to remember its design. The player is then plunged into darkness, with only a small adjacent section of the maze illuminated. In 1-player games, the player races against time, while in a 2-player game, both players race simultaneously through the randomly generated map. The goal is to travel from the top left corner of the map to the exit on the bottom right.
title: Thunder Island

description:
The Bermuda Experience is a fantasy adventure for the Atari 400/800.

Played from a top-down scrolling point of view, the player controls the SS Nemesis, which must explore the secrets of the Bermuda Triangle, and safely navigate a number of time zones and mysteries. The player starts in contemporary times, and can explore the islands of the Caribbean. The player has limited fuel, weapons, and food, but can resupply by visiting some of the islands. The player will encounter enemies, and are warned repeatedly as they approach. As the player travels to the east, they encounter a mysterious storm, and then time warps. As the player enters a time warp, they must explore the new zone for a way to return home. Zones include pre-historic times, pirate times, and a maze controlled by the mysterious Guardian. As the player completes each zone, they are transported back to contemporary times. Each time, the player can travel further to the east, until they eventually encounter and complete all 4 time warps.

The game contains a combat system, and the player is warned when enemies are nearby. Monsters present on the map will move incessantly towards the player. When the player is engaged, they can choose 3 types of attack: launch a shell, fire a torpedo, or shoot a ground to air missile. Only one type of attack will be effective on a specific opponent, killing it instantly.
title: The Bermuda Experience

description:
Clonus is a graphical adventure game for Atari 400/800.

The player has arrived in the far flung future from the present day via a time gate. Unfortunately, as they emerge into the future city of Clonus, the gate behind them closes, and they are stuck in the future. A top-down scrolling adventure game, the goal is to seek out the Key of Time, which allows the player to gain access to the Time Chamber, and return to the present day. The city has an arena where the player can battle a gladiator, a casino to make money, and a clone store to sell body parts. There are various warp chambers throughout the city, which take the player to special locations. One of these will take the player to the Crystalware offices, whom created the game. Here, the player can find the Key of Time.

Several zones have wandering monsters which will attack the player. When the player encounters a monster, they will lose 10 units of energy in their defeat of the creature. The player starts with a total of 100 energy units, and when all are lost, it's game over.
title: Clonus

description:
Clonus II is a graphical adventure game for the Atari 400/800.

You have wandered into the city of the future, circa 2086. You have no money nor belongings, but your goal is to create a clone of yourself. There is a large city to explore, and the player must make enough money to buy a head, torso, two arms, and two legs, to create a clone. After creating a clone, the player is hunted by the police force, regularly throwing the player in jail when they are discovered. The player can walk out of jail unharmed, though, as there are no bars in the jail. The city layout is identical to that seen in the original Clonus. There is an arena where the player can battle a gladiator, a casino to make money, and a clone store which sells body parts. There are various warp chambers throughout the city, which take the player to special locations including a troglodyte cavern and the offices of the game's developer.

Several zones have wandering monsters which will attack the player. When the player encounters a monster, they will lose 10 units of energy in their defeat of the creature. The player starts with a total of 100 energy units, and when all are lost, it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Exploring the Temple of the Dolphins

title: Clonus II

description:
Treasure Island is a Caribbean-themed adventure game for the Atari 400/800.

Played from a top-down scrolling point of view, the player controls a small ship, and must explore the Caribbean in search of 4 map pieces. Each one of the map pieces are hidden on an individual island, while many islands are empty, requiring the player to explore extensively. The player can visit port to purchase a number of items, including: food, lamps, sails, and ropes. When all 4 map pieces are collected, the location of the eponymous treasure is revealed, and the player can sail to its location. Maps can be found on the Island of Carnivorous Plants, Crypt Island, and others.

The player starts with 100 health points. When they are attacked by a monster or encounter dangerous terrain, they lose 10 points, and the enemy is destroyed. If all health is lost, the player perishes.
title: Treasure Island

description:
Imperial Walker is a compilation of 5 Atari 400/800 games by Mike Potter.

Imperial Walker Battle - The player controls a large Imperial Walker from the Star Wars series. The goal is to shoot down menacing spaceships which harass the walker. The player has 30 seconds, and is awarded 10 points for every space ship shot, but loses 1 point if their shot misses, and loses 10 points if they are shot in the neck. In a 2-player game, 1 player additionally controls the space ship.

Auto Race - The player controls a small car which must navigate a series of twisty passages. The player can turn left or right, and has a total of 4 speeds. If their vehicle strikes a wall, it is game over. The player gains points dependent on how far and fast they travel. There are 4 difficulty levels of tracks.

Laser Nim - Based upon the game Android Nim, the player controls 3 robots, who can selectively remove 1, 2, or 3 robots from a series of 2, 4, or 5 robots. Each player takes turns removing robots, with the winner being the player whom removes the last robot.

Gunfight - A 1-player versus computer or 2-player game, where two cowboys attempt to shoot each other. Each cowboy has 5 shots per round, and the 1st player can only shoot right, and the second player can only shoot left. The fighters move on a cactus-infested field, and the player gains a point if they shoot their opponent. Best out of 11 is the victor.

Snake & Shake - The player controls a snake that progressively elongates every time it collects a pellet on the field. The player is awarded 10 points for every pellet collected. The player is destroyed if they run into a wall or into their own snake.
title: Imperial Walker

description:
Speedway Blast is 1 - 2 player an arcade driving game for the Atari 400/800.

The neighborhood has been invaded by asphalt eating monsters, and total chaos is about to ensue. You hop into your speedster to blast these creatures, but beware of dangers including monster eggs ready to hatch and holes in the concrete. You must rid your town of these monsters and save your community.

The player drives a small vehicle which can move in the 4 cardinal directions, but can only turn 90 degrees at a time. The vehicle has 2 separate speeds. You also have a small cannon which can fire forwards to destroy monsters. The game is played in a small town, which loops to the north and south. The player has limited fuel, but will gain more when they lose a life or destroy monster eggs. A small map shows the location of all monster eggs prior to hatching, and the resultant monster. The goal is to destroy all these creatures, to advance to a more challenging stage where fuel depletes more quickly.

If the player strikes buildings, trees, or monsters, they lose a life. 3 lives lost, and it's game over. A bonus car is awarded every 10,000 points.
title: Speedway Blast

description:
Survival of the Fittest is a 1-player or competitive 2-player strategy game based on cellular biology for the Atari 400/800.

The player attempts to create a colony of cells which must be arrayed in a specific pattern to promote optimal cellular growth. Players take turns either laying down cell pattern, watching growth of colonies, and then laying down more cellular tissue based upon the pattern that develops. Cells that are placed too close together will choke out growth, while cells that are positioned too sparsely will die out. Opposing team cells will inhibit growth of their opponent.

There is an option for single-player practice sessions, 2-player competition where cells cannot interact, and 2-player competitions where cells interact on the same field. In single-player mode, the player can place infinite cells. In a competitive game, each player as an initial timed setup phase where they establish their colony. The game then varies between a growth phase where colonies mutate and seeds regenerate, and a modification phase where accumulated cells can be placed. The winner is the player with the most cells at the end of the timed period.

There are 6 game options affecting cell growth: normal, handicap, solid walls, fast, wild, and slow.
title: Survival of the Fittest!

description:
Ghost Hunter is a 1 - 2 player Pac-Man clone for the Atari 400/800.

The mansion on Huckleberry Hill is haunted. Your mission is to rid the mansion of ghosts before they get you. The player controls a small character, whom must eat a series of dots within a maze. In 2-player mode, 2 players play simultaneously. Hunting the player are 4 ghosts, whom if come in contact will cause the player to lose a life. The player starts with 3 lives. There are 4 power pellets on each level, which when consumed, make the ghosts temporarily vulnerable. Each level has progressively faster ghosts.

Has several unique features, including instant-hide, which causes a player to instantly disappear for 5 seconds, to save themselves from ghost attack. Can only be used once per life. Periodically, small pieces of the player character will appear on the screen, and if 6 are discovered, the player gains a new life. There are 15 pre-designed level designs to play, plus a random level generator.
title: Ghost Hunter

description:
Megalegs is a 1-player Centipede clone for the Atari 400/800.

The player controls a small character which can move horizontally at the bottom of the screen. The player can fire rapidly vertically towards the top of the screen. A large centipede starts at the top of the screen and moves horizontally in rows towards the player. The centipede breaks into segments when shot, and the player moves to a more challenging level every time a centipede is destroyed. Further complicating the player's task are Dweebs which fall directly towards the player, and Squirtles which hop about the screen. If the player is struck by any of these enemies, they lose a life. The field regularly fills with mushrooms which serve to block the player's firing and monster movement. The player starts with 3 lives, and gains an additional life every 10,000 points.
title: Megalegs

description:
Kayos is a 1-player space-themed arcade shooter for the Atari 400/800.

Time has ceased to exist since Kayos took over. The world is unknown, and all records were lost when asteroids eradicated all life on the planet's surface. The world's computer has established a network of underground base stations to ward off the Kayotians. You play as one of these bases to defend from the attacking Kayotians.

The player controls a small spaceship which can move horizontally on the screen, and fire vertically forwards. There are 3 difficulty levels: beginning, intermediate, and normal. A series of motherships streak across the top of the screen, deploying attack ships to harass the player. After a mothership is destroyed, a bomb will be launched towards the player. A small invulnerable "Anti-War Distractor" continuously scrolls from the right of the screen to block the player's shots.

The player starts with 5 ships, and has the ability to gain a new ship every 10,000 points. If all ships are lost, it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Pink Mothership Flies Across the Screen

title: Kayos

description:
Pogoman is a 1-player arcade game for the Atari 400/800.

The player controls a man on a pogo stick, who must travel through town while avoiding a number of obstacles. In the first level, the player must jump over fire hydrants, mail boxes, and parked cars. The player gains bonus points by jumping up and turning off the lights in town. In the second stage, unicyclists, chickens, and cats are added to the mix to increase difficulty. In the third stages, birds swoop down upon the Pogoman to further harass his trip through town. The player starts with 5 lives, and gains an additional life every time they make a successful trip through town. If the player falls off their pogostick, they must repeat a portion of the town they have already completed.
title: Pogoman

description:
Alien Swarm is a space-themed arcade game for the Atari 400/800.

The player controls a small vessel on the bottom of the screen which can move horizontally and fire vertically. On the bottom of the screen are a limited number of power packs. A player must grab a power pack to have the energy to fire, and every shot will reduce their energy supply.

A red snake-like figure moves about the screen in a Qix-like fashion. It has eyes that can be shot for points, and at higher levels a spinning tail that will break off and fly about the screen like a boomerang. As it moves, it drops green bugs that descend and attempt to steal your limited power packs. If it grabs one of these, they can be shot, but the player must be careful not to be hit by the falling pack. If the player shoots the red snake, a bouncing bomb will drop at the player and threaten them. When a player has lost all power packs, it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Aliens try to Steal my Power Packs

title: Alien Swarm

description:
Baseball is a 1 or 2 player sports game for the Atari 400/800.

A 1-player versus computer or 2 player sports baseball game, where the blue and red team compete. All gameplay occurs from a top down perspective. During the pitching phase, the player uses the joystick to select 3 speeds of pitch, as well as a curve to the left, right, or straight. The player can throw balls or strikes. The player individually controls their outfielders, who must return retrieved balls. The batting player has the option of attempting to steal bases, and can bunt. There are 2 modes of difficulty, little and major league, and a complete game takes 9 innings.
title: Baseball

description:
Captain Beeble is an underwater 1-player arcade game for the Atari 400/800.

The player controls a diver named Captain Beeble, who must gather underwater crystals and return them to the Crystal Processing Unit (C.P.U.) The player has a total of 200 fuel to power them to the crystal at the other end of the level and back. If the player strikes a monster or moving block under water, they lose a life, and the player starts with 5 lives in total. The player can shoot and destroy monsters with their pistol. After collecting a power crystal, the player has to return the crystal to the C.P.U. within 20 seconds, or they will explode. Each stage becomes progressively more difficult.
title: Captain Beeble

description:
Guardians of the Gorn is a 1 or 2 player arcade game for the Atari 400/800.

The player must rescue spaceships and aliens from the grasp of the deadly Gorn and his Guardians. The player crawls along the webs of the spider-like Guardians, while avoiding their grasp. If they catch the player, they'll be fed to the moth-like Gorn. The Gorn will intermittently appear on the screen to try to eat the player. The player can destroy tendrils as they walk along them, but must be careful not to knock themselves off. After collecting all objects on the screen, the player must return to the corner of the level where they started. The player has 3 lives, and when all are lost, it's game over.
title: Guardians of the Gorn

description:
Hard Hat Willy is a 1-player arcade game for the Atari 400/800.

Life is tough when you're only 6 inches tall, especially when you come home to find your house invaded by the Woka-wokas. Willy must stabilize his home and destroy the enemy eggs laid throughout. The player controls Willy, a small creature with a large prehensile tongue. At the beginning of each level, the player faces off against a large centipede, and the player must grab pieces with their tongue. Any sections that escape then roams through the level to harass the player as they explore their home. The player is also at danger from gnashing teeth which roam the level and environmental dangers. In each stage, the player must use their tongue to grab a hard hat from flying birds. This hat protects for 1 hit against monsters, but is also required to smash eggs through the level. There are also sections of wall which need to be stabilized by walking past them. When all walls are stabilized and eggs are smashed the player progresses the next level. Each level makes a slight alteration to the map, which opens up new larger areas to explore, and more wall to stabilize. The player starts with 9 lives, and when all are lost it's game over.
title: Hard Hat Willy

description:
Intruder! is a 1-player arcade game for the Atari 400/800.

Somewhere in the nation's capital lies a research and development installation powered by four small fusion power plants, which provide the energy for this facility. Two dedicated robo-units provide maintenance and security for this installation, and have been programmed to permanently eliminate any unlawful intruders to this level. These robots have functioned so efficiently that researchers have taken to storing all their classified documents on this level. Then, an earthquake struck, the filing cabinets have been strewn throughout the level, and the 4 power plants have begun to overheat. You control a small robot which must deactivate these 4 fusion reactors and neutralize the robots.

The player plays in a large screen full of filing cabinets with 4 red fusion reactors spaced on the screen. The player can push rows of filing cabinets to rearrange the environment. The goal is to avoid the enemy robots, and trap them within a block of filing cabinets so they cannot move. The player also has a limited time to access the 4 fusion reactors and deactivate them to prevent the facility from melting down. There are 4 difficulty levels, which affect robot speed, number of robots, and the time until the reactors melt down. The player is rewarded a score based upon the time they take to complete the mission.
title: Intruder!

description:
Hazard Run is a 1-player racing game for the Atari 400/800.

Loosely based upon the TV show The Dukes of Hazard, the player controls a large red vehicle as they race through the backwoods avoiding police cars. The vehicle can move horizontally left and right. The car continuously accelerates until the player hits an object, at which point the player loses a vehicle and their speed is reset to zero. If the player runs close to an object, their car will flip onto 2 wheels, and the player must steer down, or the car will flip. The player has limited gas, and must pick up gas tanks to complete longer races. The player must avoid a number of hazards, including: trees, fences, police barricades, rocks, walls, chickens, deer, and lakes. At the end of every level, the player attempts to jump across a river. If they have enough speed, they will clear the canyon, as they watch the police crash into the river behind them. The player starts with 5 vehicles, and when all are lost it's game over. Contains 4 tracks of increasing difficulty: Chicken Run, Walton Wood, Bryan's Pond, and Hell's Canyon.
title: Hazard Run

description:
Hockey is a 2 - 4 player ice hockey game for the Atari 400/800.

A 3 - on - 3 ice hockey game for 2 - 4 players. Allows multiple different time frames per period to control the length of game. Each player controls one player on the ice at a time, and can pass or shoot. The player who next gets the puck becomes the active player. The defensive player can intercept passes or shots, and can take the puck away from the player who has the puck. At the end of regulation time, the player with the most points wins. If it is a tie, the players go to sudden death overtime.
title: Hockey

description:
Soccer is a 2 - 4 player soccer sports game for the Atari 400/800.

A 3 - on - 3 soccer game for 2 - 4 players, with a 4th player in goal. Allows multiple different time frames per half to control the length of game. Each player controls one player on the field at a time, and can pass or shoot. The player who next gets the ball becomes the active player. The defensive player can intercept passes or kicks, and can take the ball away from player who has the ball. The game has basic rules for a ball going offside, where it is returned to the opposing team. At the end of regulation time, the player with the most points wins. If it is a tie, the players go to sudden death overtime.
title: Soccer

description:
Space Bowl is a 2 - 4 player soccer-like game for the Atari 400/800.

A 3 - on - 3 sports game for 2 - 4 players featuring large insects as players. Each team has a small net which continues to scroll vertically across the sides of the screen. 4 points are rewarded every time a shot is scored. Gameplay options allow the player to define the time per game and number of players. Each player controls one insect on the field at a time, and can pass or shoot. The player who next gets the ball becomes the active player. The defensive player can intercept passes or kicks, and can take the ball away from player who has the ball. The game has basic rules for a ball going offside, where it is returned to the opposing team. At the end of regulation time, the player with the most points wins. If it is a tie, the players go to sudden death overtime.
title: Space Bowl

description:
Anti-Sub Patrol is a 1 - 2 player naval strategy game for the Atari 400/800.

The player controls a military vessel, that must hunt for two submarines on a large 13 x 19 grid. The player moves about the grid, and has the ability to scan for submarines in each quadrant they move into. When the player is adjacent to a submarine, they have the option to launch a depth charge and set the depth of the explosion. If the player correctly ascertains the location and depth of the submarine, it is destroyed.
