If the enemy helicopters catch the purple object it temporarily disappears. The player gathers points every time they catch the object, and more enemy helicopters appear on the screen. There are 3 levels of difficulty. The player starts with 5 helicopters, and loses one when they collide with a plane or helicopter.
title: Copter Chase

description:
Deuces Wild is a 1-player poker game for the 8-bit Atari.

On a business trip to Las Vegas, you lose all but $500 of your gambling money when an unscruptulous real estate salesman sells you ocean front property in Nevada. Undaunted, you take your $500 to the poker table, determined to break the dealer and win back all you've lost before business associates find out.

The player and computer are dealt 5 cards 1 at a time. After each bet the player receives an additional card up to 5 cards. At the end of the game, the player must calculate the score for both hands. The winner keeps the pot.
title: Deuces Wild

description:
Dragon Defense is a 1-player arcade game for the 8-bit Atari.

King Arthur is dead, and the wicked Prince Mordred now rules Camelot. Guenevere, the exiled queen, has asked Merlin for the power to destroy Mordred and return the kingdom to glory. Will Merlin reach Guenevere before Mordred's dragons destroy him?

The player must attempt to move Merlin from the left side of the screen to reach Guenevere on the right, while avoiding the fire breathing dragon that separates them.
title: Dragon Defense

description:
Fire & Flood is a 1-player arcade game for the 8-bit Atari.

The house on the cliff is burning! People are trapped! Minutes after the devastating eruption of Mount St. Helen, as storms rage and floods engulf the lowlands, the player must maneuver their helicopter through flying debris toward a daring rescue. The player must rescue as many victims as possible before the rushing water covers the launch pad.

The player's helicopter moves in all directions, and the player must navigate to the burning house and return to the launch pad. Each successful return awards points. Falling debris deflects the helicopter, making it hard to navigate.
title: Fire & Flood

description:
Foreign Legion is a 1-player arcade game for the 8-bit Atari.

The player had joined the Foreign Legion, and must capture enemy forts. The player controls a crosshair, and must shoot enemy fighters that rapidly move between windows and locations at the top of the fortress. When 50 enemies are shot, the fort is captured, and the player starts an identical new fort. The player has 250 friendly fighters who are depleted at a set rate. It's game over when all friendly troops are lost.
title: Foreign Legion

description:
Gladiator is a 1-player arcade game for the 8-bit Atari.

The player controls a swordsman who moves in all directions with their sword thrust out to the right. The player tries to defeat the black Barbarian swordsman of evil by hitting them with their sword without getting hit by the Barbarian's sword. Small Roman soldiers appear from the peripheries of the screen and move towards the center. These can be defeated by hitting them with the sword, but can also cost the player a life. Bonus items appear on the screen that can be picked up. There are 3 difficulty levels. The player starts with 5 lives, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Gladiator

description:
Gorgon is a 1-player arcade game for the 8-bit Atari.

Jason the Argonaut is on his treacherous mission to rescue the beautiful Golden Fleece. Be alert to the ruthless assaults of Medusa the Gorgon. The player moves Jason around the screen, and can use his shield for protection while moving. The Golden Fleece moves randomly about, and the player must avoid running into boulders. When the player presses the joystick button, Medusa appears, and the exit staircase appears. The player has to then grab the Golden Fleece and escape up the stairs without being hit by Medusa. The player starts with 5 lives, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Gorgon

description:
Gower Gulch is a 2-player arcade game for the 8-bit Atari.

Two cowboys face off at Gower Gulch trying to shoot the other. Each player can move in all directions and fire horizontally in the opposite direction. A counter at the top of the screen tracks the number of hits received by each side.
title: Gower Gulch

description:
Hammer Head is a 1-player arcade game for the 8-bit Atari.

A peaceful underwater expedition to gather fish for the Smithsonian Institute becomes a potentially deadly encounter with King Neptune beneath the mysterious waters of the Bermuda Triangle in a game of evasion and countermove. The player moves their submarine vertically at the left of the screen, and can fire horizontally. They gain points by shooting fish and the hammerhead shark that approach from the right. The player starts with 5 lives. There are 3 levels of difficulty.
title: Hammer Head

description:
Hawk Fire is a 1-player arcade game for the 8-bit Atari.

Grotesque fowl, with a taste for blood, gather in ominous numbers and attack the land of men. Swiftly they glide and dart through the skies leaving mayhem in their wake. The player controls a character who moves all directions along the ground, and must destroy the hawks and hawkdroids that move laterally across the screen. The player can fire horizontally, or shoot down and bounce their shots back into the sky. The player must avoid fire from the white hawk at the top of the screen and creatures that move along the ground. There are 3 levels of difficulty, and the player starts with 5 lives.
title: Hawk Fire

description:
Hydra is a 1-player arcade game for the 8-bit Atari.

For two months the city has been under surveillance. Not by neighboring police or an enemy country, but by hostile aliens. They've already kidnapped children from the streets, and have now returned to pillage again.

The player controls a crosshair, and tries to shoot incoming alien vessels while trying to protect their city at the bottom of the screen.
title: Hydra

description:
Mad Genius is a 1-player arcade game for the 8-bit Atari.

The player controls a small square that can move in all directions and fire vertically upwards. An enemy vessel travels laterally across the top of the screen and returns fire only when fired upon. After the player fires, if they move laterally their shot follows them. A randomized maze appears each time the player or enemy is hit which the player can navigate. If the maze is shot by the enemy several times or the player is hit, then the computer gains a point. The player gains a point each time the computer is hit.
title: Mad Genius

description:
Red Zone is a 1-player arcade game for the 8-bit Atari.

German Field Marshal Erwin Rommel, one of history's best military strategists , must capture the "Red Zone" in the heart of North Africa's World War II battlefield. The player's mission is to maneuver their jeep, which can move in all directions, across the barbed wire in the center of the screen to capture Rommel's men positioned across the Eastern Front. The player must try to move all the men from the east side of the screen to the west before time runs out. Some prisoners will escape and move back to the right. Enemy tanks can be destroyed for bonus points each level. If the player fails to capture all men, it's game over. There are 3 levels of game difficulty.
title: Red Zone

description:
Ship of Stars is a 1-player arcade game for the 8-bit Atari.

The player controls a crosshair that moves in all directions, and the screen scrolls laterally. Enemy alien ships appear one at a time, and the player tries to fire and destroy these. The player has 5000 time units to destroy as many ships as possible, and gains an extra 100 time units for each ship destroyed. There are 2 levels of difficulty, and the final score is based upon the number of alien ships destroyed.
title: Ship of Stars

description:
Zip Zap Zonked is a 2-player arcade game for the 8-bit Atari.

In the mysterious eighth dimension, where all matter exists as light, the powerful knight Tanglor and his nemesis, Prince Puzlor, begin their joust for power.

Each player controls a spaceship that moves in all directions. When the player presses the joystick a laser beam is created from the prior laser position, creating a long series of criss-crossing beams. The players can safely move through their own beams, and gain a point if the enemy hits their beam.
title: Zip Zap Zonked

description:
British Heritage: Jigsaw Puzzles Vol 1 is a jigsaw puzzle game for the 8-bit Atari.

The player completes two puzzles displaying either the Tower of London or London's Tower Bridge. There are 8 difficulty levels, which define the size and number of pieces. Pieces are chosen from a moving belt, and on easier difficulty levels, the computer will correct pieces placed in the wrong location.
title: British Heritage: Jigsaw Puzzles Vol 1

description:
British Heritage: Jigsaw Puzzles Vol 2 is a jigsaw puzzle game for the 8-bit Atari.

The player completes two puzzles displaying either Windsor's Castle or Anne Hathaway's Cottage. There are 8 difficulty levels, which define the size and number of pieces. Pieces are chosen from a moving belt, and on easier difficulty levels, the computer will correct pieces placed in the wrong location.
title: British Heritage: Jigsaw Puzzles Vol 2

description: An evil king has imprisoned a beautiful princess in his castle and you, Sir Cyril the Brave, must rescue her. To do this, you will need to negotiate a maze to find a room with three stair-cases. Two of these lead to a tower and a dungeon respectively, which are dead ends and return you to the start of the maze. The third leads to the trapdoor room, which if successfully navigated takes you to the princess. You are then given a score depending on your time to complete the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Your princess is in another tower.

title: Knight for a Day

description:
Livewire is a variant of the arcade game Tempest for the Atari 8-bit platform. You play as a logic probe that is attempting to find and eliminate electronic faults in your computer. There are six types of faults: arcs, surges, transients, voltage spikes, resistances and shorts.

The game takes place on the surface of wires of various shapes, that extend into the screen. You can move about the circumference of the wire, avoiding enemies that climb towards you up the circuit lines, and getting into position to return fire with electron bursts. Each of the different fault types have their own type of behaviour. Arcs can travel between circuit lines while surges can move only up and down. Transients turn invisible for periods of time, while voltage spikes become shorts once they reach your side of the circuit. Resistances and shorts can only be destroyed using a "zap", which can only be activated once per level, and rids the entire screen of faults. Once all of the enemies have been defeated, you move onto the next level with a different wire shape. There are 64 levels in all, with the first eight shapes corresponding to letters from the title "LIVEWIRE".

sample_screenshots.caption: Level 1. Dealing with arcs and surges.

title: Livewire

description:
The Lone Raider is an arcade platform game consisting of three stages, where you must raid an enemy base to destroy its transmitter.

In the first stage, you must shoot robots that appear from the sides of the screen with your sonic laser, and duck as they shoot at you. Once enough of the enemy are destroyed, an indestructable terminator appears and you need to escape inside the enemy base before you are crushed.

The second stage involves collecting dots, in the neutron storeroom, which is a building with eight floors. Mutant guards patrol the area, and the floors are connected by zap doors which are periodically activate, sucking you through whether you want to go or not. Each floor has a patrolling blue proton. Capturing this will charge you up for a limited period of time and allow you to destroy mutants on contact while it is active. The goal of this level is to first capture all of the neutrons, and then make your way to the bottom of the screen and exit through a newly created zap door.

Stage three is a simpler three-floor maze, but with fast and deadly defensites that move about in eccentric patterns. Once you have made it to the transmitter at the bottom right of the maze, your job is done and you are beamed back into your spaceship, ready to start again at a higher level of difficulty.
title: The Lone Raider

description: Gold Diggers is a turn-based puzzle game based on the PopCap title Mummy Maze Deluxe. The role of the explorer is taken over by rich gentlemen who run away from the young ladies chasing them. The game was created at the 8bit GameJam "Grawitacja" organized annually in Krakow, Poland.
title: Gold Diggers

description: Play After Me is a Simon Says-style game. The computer plays a number of random notes and the player must repeat the notes. The sequence of notes gets longer and longer, making it harder for the player to repeat.
title: Play After Me

description:
Pharaoh's Pyramid is a variant of the arcade game Q*Bert . You play as little Achmed, who is forced by the Pharaoh Ramses to build his pyramid. Complete all six levels and you win treasure and the gratitude of the goddess Isis. But the jealous god Osiris will try and stop you by any means.

The game is played on an isometric pyramid of blocks. You can move diagonally between blocks, but jumping off the edge of the pyramid will cause you to plummet to your doom. Each time you visit a block, it changes colour. In every round, your first goal is to collect contruction material from the river at the bottom of the screen and return it to the top, to add a layer to a new pyramid. After this, you have to change all of the blocks to some specified colour.

There are many foes that hinder your task. On most rounds, Moses' Snake will slowly follow you around. Different rounds beset you with additional biblical plagues such as frogs, locusts, etc. These enemies appear near the top of the pyramid and meander their way downwards, before disappearing at the bottom. In the final round, you must deal with Osiris himself. Contact with any foe means death. Isis will occasionally appear at one of the bottom corners of the screen, granting you magic that will temprarily remove all foes from the pyramid.

After you have completed eight rounds, you start the next level which adds extra difficulties. The first level is "Slave". The second is "Builder", which adds another possible square colour and a crocodile that patrols the river near the building material. The third "Architect" level introduces the god Set, who will come by and knock you off the normally safe top block of the pyramid. By the final "Pharaoh" level, enemies are moving much faster, and can make holes through the pyramid which will trap the unwary. Both starting level and the game speed are selectable at the start of the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: The god Set near the top of the pyramid.
Plagued by the angels of death.

title: Pharaoh's Pyramid

description:
Pharaoh's Pyramid is an arcade game for the 8-bit Atari.

The player controls Little Achmed as he tries to complete the Pharaoh's pyramid by jumping around on it. The player jumps between blocks which change color as the player moves across them. The goal is to transform all blocks to the same color, and the player can move onto buttons at the bottom of the screen to build sections of the pyramid.

The player must avoid a number of enemies including: crocodiles which patrol the bottom of the screen, locusts that move at the top of the screen, Moses' snake that moves randomly about the pyramid, holes in the pyramid, and Osiris, who changes the pyramid colors.

The sun and the moon slowly move across the top of the screen. The player starts with five lives, and loses a life if they fall off the pyramid or touch an enemy. The player can select the difficulty level which controls game speed, or the technical complexity which controls how blocks are colored in.
title: Pharaoh's Pyramid

description:
Powerstar is a science fiction-themed text adventure with graphics for the 8-bit Atari.

In the 21st century, all electrical power in the United States is generated by a single huge nuclear fusion reactor, the Powerstar, placed in orbit safely away from living things and saboteurs. The power is then transmitted directly to local communities by means of a vast array of microwave transmitters.

Unfortunately, the one man crew of the Powerstar seems to have had a bad bout of cabin fever, and the only message from him in the last week consisted of a facsimile of a Jack Daniel whiskey bottle label. The player is the alternative engineer for the Powerstar, and the government has summoned the player to active duty to save the vital Powerstar.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. The player moves between areas with the N, S, E, and W commands. in each room, the player can rotate in four separate directions to see other areas of the room. There are a total of 10 game slots. Maximum score is 216 points.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Pack of Matches on a Table

title: Powerstar

description:
Cloak of Death is a text adventure with graphics for the 8-bit Atari.

The player has been deposited in an old haunted house and must escape. They face numerous dangers, including hungry rats, devil dogs, and the evil possessed cloak of the former master of the house.

All locations are graphically displayed, and all command are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Cloak of Death

description: Kingsoft's Fortress Underground for Atari computers is similar to the versions released on other platforms, but is a unique design. The player controls a hoverbike and is tasked with exploring a labyrinthine underground cavern and finding the exit. The cavern is full of gun emplacements, tanks, and some flying enemies, all of which can be taken out with the bike's laser cannon. In addition, there are rocket launchers that cannot be destroyed; only their projectiles can. The bike's energy levels continually decrease, with depletion meaning game over, but the energy can be refilled at recharging stations. The cave consists of distinct sections that are separately loaded. If the player should lose a life, they can continue at the current section.
title: Fortress Underground

description:
Silicon is a top-down arcade maze game in the style of Rally X but set on the inside of a silicon chip. You control a miniature debugger, which must traverse the maze to collect all of the stray bits while avoiding dangerous enemies.

There are two types of enemy in the maze. Bugs, visible on the radar, are constantly on patrol. You can shoot these to return them to egg form where they are immobile but still deadly. Occasionally, a glitch will appear at a random time. When this happens, a "heartbeat" is played as a sound cue. The frequency of the heartbeat slowly increases as the glitch becomes more serious, and you will lose a life if it is not destroyed within a certain time.

The stray bits to be collected appear as shimmering symbols. You can only carry four of these at a time, after which you should take them to the output port at the top right of the maze. Picking up a bonus, appearing as an octagon, will cause your debugger to change colour and become invulnerable for a period of 20 seconds. Getting all stray bits will take you to the next skill level, unless a glitch is active, in which case it must be dispatched first. Later levels have different layouts, and faster and more numerous bugs.

sample_screenshots.caption: Deliver bits to the output port.
A bug in egg-form is dead ahead.
Losing a life to a glitch.

title: Silicon

description:
Games Ataris Play is a compilation of BASIC type-in games for the 8-bit Atari.

  • Programming Word and Number Games
  • SCI-FI
  • Alarm Clock
  • Area
  • Atari Learner
  • Biorhythm
  • Brain Teaser
  • Craps
  • Cryptogram
  • Digits
  • Hangman
  • IRS Man
  • Nim
  • Numbers Away
  • Phone Decoder
  • Pizza
  • Reverser

  • Transition

  • Programming Graphic Action Games

  • Mubble Chase
  • Air Attack
  • Atari Artist
  • Block 'Em
  • Brick Wall
  • Dragon's Lair
  • Land Baron
  • Point Attack
  • Rocket Duel
  • Stranded
title: Games Ataris Play

description:
Devil Dwell Dungeon is a roleplaying game for the 8-bit Atari.

The player enters into the dreaded Devil Dwell Dungeon in search of the Golden Scepter. The player must explore corridors, rooms, and tunnels, while being wary of many traps and the monsters who are searching for the player. The player can pick up a number of treasures during their adventure, which defines their final score which ranges from stable cleaner to Superlord of Superlords. There are three levels of difficulty.
title: Devil Dwell Dungeon

description:
Roadblock is a 1-player arcade game for the Atari 400/800.

The object of the game is to cross the screen without running out of fuel, while avoiding road blocks and moving trucks.
title: Roadblock

alternate_titles.title: Scram: A Nuclear Power Plant Simulation
